review: This is another great spot to take the family and have a satisfying lunch or dinner. They have a variety options to accommidate  the hunger needs but my favorite is their spicy Chipotle chicken which has Chipotle adobo sauce, shaved poblanos and Monterey Jack with housemade roasted corn & black bean salsa, fresh cilantro and tangy lime crema. The flavor profiles in this winner will have the taste buds playing music in your mouth. Their Carne Asada pizza is also a great choice as it has Tender marinated steak, fire-roasted poblanos, cilantro pesto, yellow onions, Mozzarella, Monterey Jack and fresh cilantro. Served with housemade salsa verde. The flavor and portion size of these dishes are not only generous but also will gratify the stomach. Service is extensive and the staff makes sure that your needs are met. Parking is in their lot and is generally a non issue.

California Pizza Kitchen is always a nice, reliable place to go when you want a sit down meal.  The food is always very good.  The prices are a bit expensive for what it should be.  I feel like years back they raised the prices on everything.  So unfortunately this isn't a place you can go everyday... but it's a nice mid level before you get to really pricey.  Pizzas or Jambalaya are the way to go.  Their famous for their BBQ chicken pizza, but I just had their four cheese and it was REALLY good!  The guests I was with were disappointed that they didn't offer their lunch specials on the weekend, and I admit, that is LAME!  You essentially have to order dinner portions.  They really need to rethink that!  Go prepared!!!  PLENTY of parking!!!  This location is part of a mall, but outside the mall area.
Quick, easy, convenient.  California pizza is still my top out of their selection. I did notice they have a sangria flight which was nice also.

I came in saying that we were going to have a party of 9. Hostess informed me that half our party had to be there to seat us. It started to get busy but she put plates on tables in order to keep from others getting them. once sat, service and food were great. There lunch special was a perfect amount.

Wow worst visit ever. As I was there I took notes regarding my stay. First off we got sat down and waited 12 mins just to be greeted by the waitress, just greeted. I guess she sensed our frustration in my kids since they were hungry and started giving us a bad attitude. After we order our foos the kids pizza comes out burnt, literally burnt( I have attached a photo to show) The waitress recommended my 4 year old who was crying from burnt pizza that we cut off the burnt side. I couldn't believe it. When she did that I gave her a look and then she realized it was a bad idea to say that and made another one. In the end when we had food left over and we asked for a box. She said she would box it for us and took our food to the back out of sight. I don't know what happened to our food at that point so I accepted it but trashed it outside. She could have done someone bad to it she knew we were not happy. I still have Her a 20% tip but I won't return ever
Consistently 15 minutes or more late with take out orders.  Food is okay. We keep going here because my boss likes it but he doesn't have to deal with the sub par to-go staff.

CPK's food is decent at best - normally this would qualify for 3 stars,  but given the high prices across the menu, there's really not enough here to warrant a recommendation.  I ordered the Banh Mi bowl, which was a pretty baffling name for a salad of chicken, quinoa, and vegetables that had virtually nothing in common with the baguette of roast pork, pickled veggies, and herbs that the dish is named after.  The veggies seemed fresh and the dressing was a solid if fairly typically Asian-style vinaigrette, but there wasn't much flavor throughout the dish - blanching, roasting or pickling some of the ingredients would've helped to give it some more variety.  I was also confused by the large chunks of raw serrano peppers served with the dish, since serranos are quite hot and biting down on these was pretty intense - again, picking them or even serving them in smaller pieces would've helped. The overall product was a relatively plain bowl that was probably a bit less tasty than what you'd get from a fast casual place for $7-8, but this cost $15 (and the portion was not particularly large given that most of the volume was taken up by spiralized veggies).   My recommendation is to go out and eat an actual banh mi. There are enough great, independent restaurants in this city with similar or lower prices that it really doesn't make a lot of sense to come here.

It's a very nice facility with very friendly staff and service but the food is not worth the price they charge. It's a typical chain restaurant where the food tasted mediocre but comes with a high price. We ordered the following: Thai chicken salad - very disappointing, it was drenched with peanut dressing that didn't really taste like peanuts. It was just a really sweet sauce. The full size is a pretty big portion but totally not worth $20. Took a couple bites and was over it.  Carne asada pizza - was really good. 5 out of 5 stars. It comes with a spicy salsa to dip with which has just the right amount of spiciness. The only downfall is that the pizza is on the smaller size and it was $17.  I do like how they give bread though, and it tastes pretty fresh too.

The Kung Pao Chicken and Garlic Chicken Pizza are delicious. I will probably request extra sauce on the kung pao next time because that's my favorite part. I like it saucy! The cheese on the garlic chicken pizza was different from what I remember, I wish the recipes wouldn't change.  They had a new drink there, some kind of mango strawberry cooler with lime. Very refreshing and something new. Glad this place allows their bartenders to come up with new drinks. Also ordered an Italian soda, custom order (raspberry flavor, club soda, and cream). It's kinda my thing, glad they accommodate!  We came here earlier in the day and were seated immediately. I guess it helps that it was also the weekday. Just my kind of service, fast, friendly and good food.

A family night out and the girls are craving CPK, with no reservations the wait time was about 25min. We where seated and graciously treated by our waiter who's advice came in handy when ordering for a meat lover. My BF had the Juicy, tender, perfectly grilled ribeye topped with creamy bleu cheese compound butter, roasted potatoes, and arugula salad for the perfect dinner plate. My choice of Waldorf chicken salad was tasty, fresh, and delicious. There is nothing not to love about CPK.
Mediocre at best! Not like other CPKs. Service was horrible and small plates for bread were dirty. Took three attempts to get clean plates

Although at the beginning there was a little mixup the manager gave us complimentary desserts. I wish i could have gotten our waiter's name he was soo attentive so kind. Great customer service on his behalf. I didn't get his name but was was a chubby white male.. thank you for your service. You made our evening better.

Last time that I had CPK food was 10 years ago and I wouldn't even think about trying their food after so long. Me and my sister were doing some Christmas shopping at Northridge mall, after the shopping we were starving; but due to her eating style (vegan), we couldn't just go eat anywhere, so we went to CPK to see if they can make a vegan sandwich for her. Luckily they said that they can make the Grilled Veggie sandwich as a Vegan Grilled Veggie sandwich and I ordered The Original BBQ Chicken sandwich and Super Spinach + Quinoa salad.  After ordering my sandwich I regretted that why did I order BBQ chicken, since I wasn't feeling to eat the sandwich with strong taste of BBQ sauce, but I just waited and didn't change my order. We waited 15 min for our food to be ready , thankfully not so long.  Oh my god! The Original BBQ Chicken sandwich was so bomb; bite after bite I just couldn't wait to chew. First of all, my concern was pointless, the BBQ sauce taste was so mild and the sandwich itself was so tangy and delicious. The flavors of this sandwich hit all the taste buds and literally I cannot say enough how utterly delicious was my sandwich. Spinach + Quinoa salad was amazing the sour taste of green apples added a tanginess flavor to the salad. My sister also loved her flavorful vegan sandwich. CPK really beat my expectation and I should consider CPK more often for high quality food and friendly service.  My overall experience was 5 out of 5!

It was after Christmas when I paid a visit to this CPK. It was extremely windy and yet there were a lot of people waiting to dine in. My friend and I waited about 30 minutes to be seated. The host was very nice, polite and accomodating. My server though, was not. He was really hard to find. Whenever I needed him for more water, condiments or even napkins, I had to wait forever to find him or get his attention. I know it can get busy and all but I feel like I didnt get the service that I deserve. The food was average. I honestly cant tell the difference because they all taste similar. Though my Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza was overly sweet. I know they are supposed to be sweet but it was so sweet that I couldnt eat more than a slice. The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine was good as I expected. That kick of lime which I guess is the 'tequila' is definitely pleasing to my palate and I reallly enjoyed the dish. We also got an appetizer, chips and guacamole. Even though portion was ridiculously tiny, guacamole was very fresh and wasnt too strong of flavor, which I personally prefer. I dont know if they make their own chips (I doubt it), but it was good. It was regular corn and blue corn tortilla chips. Even though service wasnt the best or attentive, food overall was satisfactory. But not sure if I will come again in the future.

Mathew is a rude seater!!! The waitress was great but the wait time sucked when we asked to sit outside Mathew said we needed to wait to still be seated even though no one was outdoors!! 45 min wait and still sat indoors. He gave us attitude!! He was very rude!!!

My family and I came here the other night for dinner with some family friends. What a mistake.  After we sat down, we waited about 10 minutes before our server even came to the table. We put in our drink orders and then waited and waited. Finally the waitress came back with drinks and we got to order our food. We each ordered something different, including a couple of salads, a pizza, soup, pasta, and the new banh mi bowl.  The food took a long time to come. About 30 minutes at least and it was very annoying to see tables who had sat down after us get their food way before us. When the food finally showed up, they were missing a lot of items. One of the salads was ordered with dressing on the side but they just brought the salad without any dressing. We had to ask them for the dressing which took another 5-10 minutes to get. We were also missing my food and the pasta that one of our friends had ordered. That took another 10 minutes or so to eat. Which meant that the other food got cold because they wanted to wait until everyone had their food to eat.  None of the food was great, and definitely wouldn't make me want to come back here. This place is also very overpriced for mediocre chain restaurant food. There's so many better options out there that I don't know why anyone would want to come here.  After over an hour here we had to ask for the check and then flag down the manager to pay our bill because our waitress never came back to the table. All in all, not a good experience. Skip this place and go somewhere else. Anywhere else has to be better than here.
Ordered a bbq chicken salad to go. It was just shredded lettuce and tomatoes. What happened to the beans, chicken, corn, cheese, tortilla chips? They just ruined my favorite salad.

So disappointed with the quality of my meal. I paid $24 including tax for their new entree & when I took a bite the meat was about 98% pure fat. I have no idea why the chef would think this would be an acceptable piece of meat to serve. Since I ordered "to go" I couldn't even complain without driving back. A total waste of my money and time.

Ordered the Italian salad asked for no onions...server returns with salad saturated in scallions didn't I ask for no onions? She says they're scallions?!#$ really? Second salad has all white core iceberg lettuce!%# returned for edible salad.   Why am I not surprised the server packed the leftover salad but provided no salad dressing!@#$  I'm done with this place too stupid for service.  Save your time and money go somewhere they understand how to prepare salads according to your taste not they're choice!

The food is okay. My sisters and I shared the alfredo fettucine, the quinoa kale salad, and artichoke and spinach pizza. Everything was fine. It's your typical chain restaurant. I never find myself suggesting to eat at CPK. It's one of those places I go when I've been invited.

Love this place. We Come here all the time. The girls get their famous avocado egg rolls and it's tasty every single time. We've tried their pastas and also their pizzas. Definitely the place to go when you're hungry.

This is my first visit here. This is a large location that is VERY loud. We were seated pretty quickly for a Friday afternoon. Service was very friendly and timely. The 2 of us ate salads which were very good. The passion fruit tea was good as well. I gave 4 stars because I feel it is robbery to pay a $60 for 2 salads 1 appetizer and 3 ice teas. Other than that overall good

Great location. Didn't have to wait for more then 5 minutes to be seated. We did however have to wait 10-15 minutes for a waiter to help us, but they rectified this by providing us with an appetizer for free. The pizza we ordered was great! Flavor there and the dough wasn't greasy or anything. Can't complain. Was a great pizza and salad! Will return!

What a great experience. It was Mother's Day but we didn't have to wait and with young kids that's a great option. Everything was fast and efficient! The waiter did such an amazing job he was very kind and patient. We came I'm around 2:30 and we seat outside wish I remembered his name. Food was as always great

I gave the restaurant 2 stars because the food was good. Customer service was lacking heavily. Waitress did not offer any bread till 10 min in, the plates were dirty, bread butter had a piece of plastic, brought out the wrong food, the manager came to our table twice to apologize, she did pick up the tab for the issues. However I wouldve preferred to have had a great meal with family, no b/s and paid for my food.

This place was pretty decent to eat at.  There was no wait when we went which was on a Wednesday around 5 pm, typical.  I ordered a pizza and it was delicious!  This is a good place to come when you don't know where else to eat

This was my first visit to CPK in awhile, and I had forgotten just how good their BBQ Chicken pizzas are... THEY ARE SO GOOD! The crust is not as sweet as I recall, but it was perfectly cooked, and delicious. We also ordered the Spinach Artichoke dip, which was pretty good (it was my first time trying this). They also have an extensive wine list, which takes the edge off the weekly grind.

Will not be returning! Absolutely disappointed in the service and wasted nearly an hour waiting for food. Me and two other business associates came for a quick lunch, ordered lunch specials expecting the meals to come out and instead... not one, not two, but three tables around us were seated after us and given their food before us. It was disappointing knowing that I couldn't rely on CPK to deliver the service I normally have come to expect. The server did not check in on us, did not bother to apologize, and it was a disaster. I had to box up a subpar lunch and take it to go... so it could be thrown in the trash.

It's been so long since I've been here, about 8 years, and it's as heavenly as I remember. Everything about it is golden; the service has always been top notch, the atmosphere is casual/trendy, and the food is unique and delicious. Today I took my little 7 week old boy since I was stuck at the apple store and got hungry. The servers and host were very accommodating and patient with me. I ordered a quinoa and pecan salad with mushroom and spinach pizza. Both were delicious. Me thinks I should make this spot a regular.
I only came here once. The server was nice, but the food wasn't really very good.

The manager at CPK on Sunday September 17th at 230 pm in the take out section - VERY RUDE.  Everyone else was pleasant except the head of the restaurant at that time. I am A postmates worker and a frequent diner of CPK. I will not visit this location for pleasure and I advised the people I delivered this postmate order to, to choose a different CPK In the future.

First off the food is amazing. I love the California Club pizza. Instead of chicken I get mushrooms and I remove the bacon. It taste BOMB!! The crust you can easily pair it with the oil they give you as a starter. That's also what I love about CPK ! While you're starving waiting for the cook to prep your meal they got you with some oil and bread. If you ask for butter they'll give you butter as well and they don't charge you for that ! The service can be slow sometimes. The servers are not as attentive or friendly. In this particular location out of about 5 times I've gone only once I was not attended well! Overall, CPK is YUMMY!
Great bbq pizza thin crust, trapani is the best host! Love this place the customer service is amazing, right when I walk in I get read it right away with a smile and it always makes me feel welcome
Since when did they shrink the portion sizes for take out orders? My salad was a kids size salad and it cost me $20! Very disappointed! It's never this small when I dine in.

Good food. We ordered the carne asada pizza which was delicious and the cob salad which was pretty good too. The service was not the best. We went on a Thursday at around 1:15 pm just after the lunch hour rush time. It was pretty crowded but we only waited 10 min to be seated. The waiter never refilled our drinks and didn't clean up our plates so we had dirty dishes piled up on our table for a good while. Not cool

My sister decided to have her bday dinner here on a Wednesday when Farmers market is going on, it makes it so hard to find parkings.   But once inside and seated, I am actually relieved of dining and enjoying a peaceful dinner.   We ordered two kinds of spring rolls the Baja w/ guacamole dip and Thai chicken roll  with sweet sauce.  I like the Baja better.   The chicken fettuccine is always good.  My Kung pao spaghetti  is a little spicy - just how I like it.  Can't go wrong with the pizzas - the kids loved it.  Salmon was good, the steak was good.  We had a great time.  Service was s bit slow.  Although our server was excellent.

3 were at the hosts section just chatting while everyone was told it will be 15-minute wait. At least 5-7 tables were empty (many outside tables were empty) and had dirty dishes on them... Once we finally sat down and had our meal - the food was not as good as other franchise locations.  Our waiter brought our check and kept circling our table every 3 minutes to see if we paid without asking if we wanted something else to eat or drink. Not a good experience at this location and no one was trying. Leaving 2 stars because of other locations CPK are so much better.
Tortilla spring rolls are good but felt they are over priced based on the quantity. We got 6 - 7 small rolls. Spicy chipotle chicken pizza is not bad - it's like a chipotle bowl on a pizza bread.

Food 4 BBQ chicken + egg (2): love the option that I can add egg on my pizza, it adds a creamy texture!  Spinach chicken fettuccine: the noodles is really bad :( too cold maybe, and too dead (not chewy) no flavor. The only time I'm disappointed at CPK.  Service 5 Always nice and sweat :)  Environment 4  Sit at the patio, I like it.

Well the CPK Northridge it has amazing customer service. The chicken tequila pasta is to die for. I love to go with my family because it's always a good time and the atmosphere is great when everyone is combined.

I wasn't starving so just went and ordered a small arugula asparagus salad & added grilled chicken to it for protein. Salad was beyond amazing! Shout out to the bartender Sedona for taking care of my "hangry" friends and I. She was great, worked well under pressure, and still carried a great smile. I worked in the restaurant industry so I understand how it is being there at the end of lunch when everyone else got cut & you're literally on your own. Thank you for AMAZING service & I really hope she is recognized by her employer, you have an amazing employee! Thank you Sedona :)

This place has some good food. We ordered this Asian pepper appetizer. The chili was roasted and drizzled in soy sauce. It was amazing! The pizza was also delicious, but the greatest. I actually liked the flat bread better. I honestly like the food here, but the prices unfortunately keep me away. There are so many pizza options in Los Angeles that are more delicious and less expensive. That's my opinion, please don't let that stop you from coming in and giving them a try...

Service is slow and none of the servers look happy. My salad was great (Chinese chicken salad), it took forever to get bread, and don't get me started on how long we waited for the check! The place was packed, we waited 20 minutes for our seat and it took us about 15 minutes to find parking. If it wasn't connected to the mall I probably wouldn't come here but it was convenient and the salad hit the spot!
The quality of food is getting worse every time we visit there the staff is pretty good but the food sucks everything is tasteless

This location is located in Northridge Mail.Hands down they did a great job last night.My server Adam did a fantastic job.He was very attentive during my visit. I ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and it was made just right. There in the process of remodeling this location and its looking great.Great Job.The other key to this location is there also going to be changing their menu,adding some new and keeping some of their favorite menu items.The change is going to take affect  this coming Saturday at all there locations. I was very impressed by another server who was explaining the menu to other guests.Her knowledge was impeccable.Great Job. Do to the remodel the location was still well maintained and most of all clean and very organized. Great Job. 2015 Yelp Challenge.048/100
Angel was great towards me and my girlfriend and very helpful and made sure our food came out quickly. Will definitely come back with service like this
Food is always good. Danielle is an amazing server she always takes our order quickly and is on top of refills. I recommend this location over any other the service and food is always on point.

This is probably the best experience I've ever had at any CPK. Our server Tanner was so attentive and so knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the Banh mi bowl per his recommendation and it was so good. We will definitely be coming back to this location soon!!!!

5 Stars for happy hour at the bar and Josh the bartender! This location has happy hour 3-6pm on weekdays and it's the perfect time to visit. $4 beers, $5 wines and $6 cocktails. Josh the bartender is very attentive and friendly. There are a few big screens at the bar - Monday night football was playing when we were there. Great spot to hang out for a drink and enjoy happy hour. The music isn't too loud and the staff is very friendly which makes a big difference.

Lunch date with my daughter and it was enjoyable indeed. The food was good as well as the company of my little princess.  We arrived before 4 P.M. and we decided to take advantage of their lunch special. We ordered the following: +++California Club Sandwich+++ I got the grilled chicken on ciabatta bread with bacon, avocado and lettuce. The bread was really crunchy not as soft and the chicken was cold. I though the chicken would be hot. Still the sandwich tasted good.  +++Tortilla Soup+++ This was rich and creamy with perfect balance with little sweetness to it. No too salty. I enjoyed it very much. +++Wild Mushroom Pizza+++ My daughter ordered this and I tried a slice. It was really good with all the ingredients coming together. Mushroom, blend of cheeses with Parmesan. I think it had spinach or some other greens that am not sure of. It was really good with that thin crust.  +++Mixed Salad+++ Lettuce, check peas, onions, tomatoes, feta cheese and vinaigrette dressing. Fresh and tasty. Extra dressing requested and was brought in fast.  +++SERVICE+++ It was right on point. The nice young waiter kept on checking on us. My Ice tea drink was not refilled but rather replaced with another one with fresh glass. I like that!  Excellent choice for food!

Me and my friend enjoyed lunch at the bar last Monday. Food was great, drinks were tasty. Service from our bartender, Shane, is what brings me to write this review. His attention to detail, social skills, and quick service is phenomenal. Despite it being a Monday lunch (probably the most dull shift of the week) he was happy, upbeat, and seemed to genuinely like his job. Thanks Shane and CPK!

This place is so over rated. It deserves a negative star. The food there is just bland and there is absolutely nothing exceptional about it. We tried couple of pizzas and a couple of side dishes and salads. I would give it a zero star if possible. Every pizza had huge tasteless, flavorless outer crust and was missing sauce. They price themselves as if they are serving the best meal possible on earth. No, just plain outright No. This is a no go place for me from now, never again.

Love the BBQ chicken pizza. This time, we tried the spinach and artichoke dip as well, and it was ok but nothing special. The servers were great and quick. Clean restaurant, and not too crowded. Will definitely be back again.

They prepare great salads and pizzas. Unfortunately, The last 3-4 times that I have gone, there are large groups of kids that are very loud and even running around. I know that can happen once in a while, but when it's too loud every time, it really ruins the experience. Now when I crave a Thai crunch salad, I usually just go eat somewhere else.

Ate here tonight and while eating something fell from the ceiling and hit my daughter in the back. People started screaming and I see A RAT running to the next table over. The restaurant was  in complete chaos, people were screaming and jumping up on the table and chairs! Someone was yelling there were two rats running into the kitchen!I seriously thought someone had a gun! I'm so confused as to why the staff is not trying to calm the place and see them all standing off the side of the kitchen. I approached the manager and I wasn't happy after she told me that "these things happen..." I questioned her asking this is just everyday normal thing that happens and she said yes ma'm! I told her in all my years over never EVER witnessed this! And she also mentioned there are lots of rats in the area which ok I get it - I live in Burbank and because of fruit trees but I HAVE NEVER WITNESSED SUCH A THING. Turns out she was the assistant General Manager - she gave me the wrong number for corporate I found out this morning. My daughter had blood on the back of her shirt because the rat was all bloody (yes we seen it ourselves) and was completely freaked out so much that she had to change her shirt into something we bought earlier at the mall in the car. In my opinion the manager should have tried to calm the customers down if nothing else announced they needed to close and send us on our way or SOMETHING other then hiding behind the counter with the rest of her employees allowing the scene to unfold into chaos so much so that t thought someone had a gun inside with as much chaos as was going on!!! I'm waiting to hear back from corporate AND the health department. If they have issues they should close their doors!! Imagine what it looks like in the mornings there after everyone has gone for the night!?!!

What a waste of our time. If only we knew this CPK was so much more inferior to other location. Not only was our quoted 25 minute wait which ended up actually 40 minutes, they didn't even have all of the menu items available. About 10 minutes after ordering, we were informed that the "carne" for our pizza was still frozen and they couldn't make it for us. Definitely not something we expect to hear from a chain restaurant, sounds like a mom and pop restaurant issue.

4/9/2016: I normally love California Pizza Kitchen but today was just a different story. I was a meeting a friend for lunch and was quoted 5 minutes. I waited longer than expected but that was fine. We were sat behind the host stand and waited to get greeted by our waitress/waiter. 10 minutes went by... 20 min... 30 minutes later my friend and I had already decided what we wanted to eat and drink and still had not been greeted. We decided to get up and leave but not without talking to the manager. The manager was literally the most rude manager I have ever met. He didn't care that he had customers walking out or that his staff had been incompetent enough to greet 2 girls (who worked in a restaurant and know what it is like during the lunch rush). It was so appalling that I haven't been back to this location when I was a regular.

I do not know what the hype is all about. Pizza was okay, I've had worse. For what you get I honestly think their food is over priced. My favorite part about dinner was their complementary bread and oil dip thingy lol  Service on the other hand was excellent, our server Tyler was terrific, he's so good at his job. My boyfriends drink never got empty he was on top of it. And checked on us frequently.  I'm not sure if I'll be back but if I ever do decide to visit again I'll try something other than their pizza.

I go to this California Pizza Location quite frequently and never have any issues, however my visit today was just plain awful and inexcusable. This review is solely based on the service.  Our server was Hillel and he was either a new server or just very scatter brained with no ability to multi-task whatsoever. I tried giving him the benefit of the doubt that maybe he is still learning or he was sat too many tables at once but the constant mistakes he made became too much. Examples include grabbing the dip for bread off the table (while we were holding bread in our hands ready to dip) without even asking if we had finished yet. My mom ordered a Hawaiian pizza for her and my grandma to share and he wrote down the order and proceeded to take mine. After writing my order down he looked at my grandma and asked what she would like and my mom said we are sharing a Hawaiian pizza remember. When they finally brought the pizza no extra plate was brought for my grandma so we asked someone for an extra plate and he brought the smallest plate he could find. We asked Hillel, our server for a bigger plate. We never got the plate, go figure.  Also, one of the managers working tonight, John, is just about the saddest excuse for a main manager. No customer service skills or knowledge of accommodating a customer. I wanted to substitute chips and salsa for a simple and small side salad and he said it can't be done. The poor employees at this restaurant are running around the restaurant busting their butts and apparently he is too good to help anyone. He walked around the restaurant aimlessly for about an hour and a half, never helping anyone. He checked the time several times to see when his shift would be over and also found the time to chat with fellow employees. An embarrassment to this establishment.  All in all, I'm not sure when or if I  will be back again.

Josh is the worst server ever. This is also the worst CPK that I've been to. The food came out after over an hour and there's no one here.  The whole seating section was waiting and looking for silverware. Drinks never refilled and it took over 20 mins to get our check. We had to get up and ask multiple servers but were ignored

Came here on a Thursday evening and surprisingly it was packed. It took 30 min to get seated and another HOUR to get our orders taken 1 HOUR.  Then 30 min for our food to come out food was messy and bland. Our server Pablo  paid no attention what's so ever to us and had to request service numerous times to get ahold of him . Bad experience . Won't be coming back

But this is always a spot that me and my family like to go to we really enjoyed their food and drinks it's usually pretty busy on the weekends being that's located in the mall but the food is always fresh and hot and always delicious servers are always fast always have good attitudes and kind courteous service it's always a pleasure and we always really enjoyed our time chicken piccata is always our favorite and the roasted halibut  Italian peach soda is delicious!! : so after a long day of shopping this is definitely a spot to sit down enjoy good food good service in a nice clean restaurant

The dining atmosphere is quite pleasant! They have great food but somewhat pricey considering their small portion size. however, pizzas are very exotic as they have many different flavors. I had Sicilian Pizza which had a thin crust and i loved it, thought in a second I was in Italy. Jacque, our waitress, was amazing at explaining the menu and taking care of our table. Overall, great place if you are looking to not eat as much and try extraordinary food!!

Today was my nieces culmination for Pre-k she wanted CPK after her ceremony. My cousin set the reservation 3 weeks in advance and even called to double check and remind them. But somehow the reservation is still managed to get messed up and they forget all about our party of 15-20 people and we are stuck there waiting for quit some time when we were even 15 mins early to our reservation and because they messed up we all were sat at different tables yeah next to each other but all still separated and couldn't converse or really fully celebrate together. Secondly, my nieces were playing with the crayons and play book they give their for children and the waitress comes to drop their mac and cheese off and because one of my nieces was not fully pay attention when she said here's you mac n cheese she just tosses the bowl down hard in front of her she was so impatient with a little girl how ridiculous can you get. I ask for the manager and express to her how that was completely unacceptable behavior and she replays with "I'm sure it was unintentional I'll speak with her" trust me if it was unintentional I would not have complained in the first place! I haven't been in a CPK for years! And to walk into one since and have this poor experience  makes me never want to come to another one again. Your already over priced with your small dishes and now poor service on top of it give me a break!

California pizza kitchen has a big menu. Extremely high prices for little food on each menu item. It's a place you visit once just to try not really good enough to be a spot to eat frequently.  On 02/15/17 I went in for lunch. This location on Tampa is staffed by unappreciative idiots. They abandon most guest and don't even think to bring your table basic things like napkins and utensils, yet they seem to have time to strike up long conversations with guest they like. Seriously me and another group there got upset with them because they wouldn't bring napkins, c'mon. I ask for more oil waitress says ok leaves then proceeds to have a 10 minute chat and doesn't return. You guys need to seriously wake up.  I advise anyone reading this review, if you want to eat CPK try another location.

Usually I don't like to write or complain, but I just was eating lunch with my customer .  Food is good but service was zero.  (I am going a lot of time ) but this time bread and appetizer come after lunch and no napkins and no small plate ?? No one come to serve water .....   Next time I will take my customer same other place  Or I can't go anymore that cpk.  Sorry for complaining but even manager didn't care  ......and try to fix problems

The food has interesting twists, like the kung pao spaghetti. Service is efficient, my wife and I were seated immediately, and our order came out very fast. Service was good, nothing stood out really, but the waitress got all the important parts right. Offering us refills or seconds on bread and was quick with the check when we finished. We went yesterday (wednesday), the place was loud, probably due to the open layout of the place, but there were crying babies, dishes shuffling, people talking loudly. So if you dont mind the noise level, everything else is pretty good. The manager came over and asked how things were and if he could get us anything. Good experience.

We (3 of us) had a terrific dinner here a couple of nights ago. I've always liked CPK, but they've really been improving/expanding everything some service, to menu, to ambiance. We ordered the avocado rolls, tequila chicken fettuccine, mushroom pizza, souffle & butter cake. Everything was delicious (as usual). They've added some things to the menu since I was last here (like the butter cake - PHENOMENAL btw!), we stuck to a lot of our usuals, but we'll definitely be back to try new menu items.  What I really have to commend this visit is the service. We loved our server - Diego, & the manager that evening - Evan (I hope I'm spelling his name correctly). We were having a great time & Diego came to the table & apologized that the food was taking longer than it should - we didn't notice at all & felt everything was timed just fine. He was insistently accommodating, checked on us without imposing very often, & just really took care of us. He also had Evan come by the table who was also very apologetic & accommodating despite us expressing much content. They then went ahead & took care of a few items on the check. When I told Diego they really didn't have to do that he insisted that they find the extra time they noticed it took unacceptable, & they especially wanted to because of how delightful we were. We're really impressed with how aware & on top of everything they were.  This was a farewell dinner we were having with my sister before my boyfriend & I move to San Diego & Diego & Evan made it very special for us. Thanks guy! We'll be back when we visit LA!

I ordered a fettuccine and had to return it back twice. The first time it was served to me, the sauce was too watery so I had to return it. Then after about 20 minutes, they returned it to me with no sauce at all. It was a dry fettuccine. I have never had a bad order from CPK until now. Quality has gone down really bad. I am so disappointed. On top of that, the manager gave us the check, which indicated that my order was comp even though I never ate any of it because I returned both of them. So disappointing. Beware of the very low quality fettuccine.

Always good to come back to CPK. The quality/taste of their foods really depends on which one you go. This CPK in Northridge is a perfect place to have a simple meal and/or celebrate anniversaries/birthdays with your family and friends. I enjoyed today's quick lunch a lot with my coworkers and sup at this spot. The server was super nice, I should've asked his name!

Due to an error on my end (mixing up Potstickers vs Dumplings) our server Josh and the manager Jared insisted on replacing our appetizer with one that was actually to our liking!  I was blown away by the genuine concern for our satisfaction by the both of them. I definitely recommend dining here, they sincerely care about your experience!
This is one of my favorite places by far! The food is always served promptly, and the people are kind and very sweet! And the bar is so always a fun place to sit and have a nice drink!

You can really judge the service of a restaurant when things don't go right. It is easy to be happy when everything is wonderful. We are results here and normally everything is perfect. Tonight we had a misunderstanding with our seating choice. The manager, Damon, immediately came over and made the situation right. His passion for service is an example of how a true leader should be. I could not be more impressed and satisfied with my experience. We will continue to be a regular customer and know we will always be well taken care of.

SPINACH DIP. Need not say more! But since I have to for a review here are my other favorites: Appetizers: avocado egg rolls and lettuce wraps Salads: BBQ Chicken and Waldorf salads  Pizza: Chipotle Chicken, BBQ Chicken, California Club, and Margherita Pasta: Jambalaya (the best I've had) Other Entrees: Steak Tacos Dessert: Red Velvet Cake or Butter cake Drinks: Pina Colada

I had lunch here this week. I tried the new lunch specials. Perfect price, perfect size. Sat at the counter and Shane took good care of me at the bar. Was in and out in less than 30 minutes.  It's nice to have quality options for around $10. Nicely done.

I have always liked CPK and I am a sucker for great service. I love this location for the superb service they have. Everyone is smiley and so welcoming. I have been coming to this location for the past 4 years the whole family love it

Signed up for the cpk app and got a free appetizer.  Placed my order online curb side.  Waited curbside and decided to go in. (Didn't have time to wait ) once at the register I mentioned to the lady that I had a coupon for a free appetizer . In which I had it on my phone   She went on with  my number for the reward. She couldn't find it although I had it available on my phone . The manager came to void the item and chuckled by saying you know how technology works ? So moral of the story.. they didn't offer me any solutions . Didn't offer me to look it up any other way. (Keep it mind ot wasn't busy at all ) won't be coming back !

They claim they have delivery but i kid u not everytime i call they have no delivery or they have nothing i want available its really annoying never again will i be coming here and they hang up on you ..when trying to order bye felicia

I haven't been here in a while, so I decided to have brunch here. PROS: -the remodel of the restaurant is really nice, spacious, & clean -friendly, welcoming staff -the frozen peach lemonade was good, as well as their spinach dip & chips CONS: -I also ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps - taste wasn't that great; kinda disappointing -PRICES are hwy robbery!!! in total, I paid $30 -_- -their to go boxes are made from recycled materials; good for the environment but bad since grease will seep through & stain OVERALL REVIEW: I'd only come back if I had the money

I love that they now have lunch specials! It is the perfect option if you want a little bit of two things. I got the bbq chicken pizza and a chicken caesar salad. Fantastic sizing and the food was delicious. Service was good too. I got the smores dessert but wasn't impressed at all. The marshmallows weren't melted so they were very sticky and got all over the place.
"new review" outta respect towards cpk i redited my review the short guy with the beard hes a bartender here been there a while he trully is the best so i felt iid fix this review

My family experience here doesn't have much to say... - Food was tasty - Service was okay-good - Prices average of a CPK, of course. - Next to a mall, yaaaas, speaking as a Valley girl. - Would return? Yes.

Great choices on the menu but the food is decent. For some reason, the food is always too bland for me. I was here last night (15 minute wait for 4 on a Thursday) and our server was bubbly, funny, and attentive. My friends enjoyed their chile relleno and tostada pizza (huge!) I ordered the veggie pizza with sausage and a very tiny side of truffle oil... it was extra for thin crust so i opted out. Def get the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake!

Came here with my kids and my daughter's friend.  I ordered the pasta with zucchini and shrimp from the low calorie menu. My daughter and her friend got the spaghetti with meat sauce and my son got the regular pepperoni pizza.  The food came out fresh and it's nice that all CPK's are consistent with their excellent food and service.

So was out with a good buddy of mine and we were trying to decide on just where to go eat dinner tonight. Some place low key after having a crazy celebratory weekend as well. And after driving by a couple of places that were either closed or looked too shady he suggested... hey you wanna go to CPK?!? I was like...uhh YA...you don't have to ask me twice about this place! Growing up in SoCal CPK is a staple of this area and if you don't know you better know by now that this place has upped its game as a franchise restaurant chain!  New more sophisticated look and atmosphere, new menu design,  new and more flavorful entrées along with some of the classics that we all know and love. Just a totally all around better experience for very reasonable prices that won't break the bank just because you want to eat out and have a nice sit down meal.  So from the outside of the restaurant it looked packed and I thought that we were going to have a long wait and maybe just eat at the bar. However as I went to park and my friend went in he texted me and said bar is opened but when I got in to my surprise he got us a table (sneaky bastard...lol). Inside the place was buzzing with a nice cool vibe and nicely lit. The noise level was moderate and not overbearing and this particular location was very big with outdoor seating to boot. We ordered after our waiter brought our waters and bread and gave us ample time to decide. And btw our waiter Tyler could not have been nicer,  more attentive and just all around more terrific of a service person than if you built one from scratch! He nailed our order and my buddy's lightly cooked BBQ pizza request came out perfect along with one of my favorite dishes here at CPK the jambalaya pasta. He was great...I liked that he was constantly asking how everything was and even the floor manager came out to check on our table. It was very pleasant and made us feel like they really wanted us to enjoy our food and the whole experience... which hello other restaurants is the whole reason we come to your establishment in the first place... to be made to feel special and cared for on top of getting a great meal. But I digress...lol.  To sum it all up... they knocked it out of the park tonight at this spot! 5 stars easy! And Tyler thanks for the special dessert as well!
Over the new food and ownership.  It's expensive and blah. Service was terrible 30 minutes to get a drink and it took an hour for my food to come once I ordered it. CPK has really gone downhill.

Went here for two big events. I had my birthday dinner here as well as a dinner with my dance team. Both huge parties and we were put out on the patio which was great because it was a lot more private. For starters, my birthday dinner was great and man I wish I could remember our server's name. I had a party of around 23 people and she was so patient with all of us. She even went along with my uncles giving her ridiculous names when she asked to separate the orders. Great night thanks to this place! And let's not forget the other dinner which consisted of 15+ crazy young adults coming together for a hip hop team dinner. We probably asked for bread about 100 times and also asked for butter instead of their oil. We were probably really noisy and difficult customers on that night because we were having so much fun (maybe the servers enjoyed that) but they really played into it and were extremely patient yet again. Great customer service from the beginning to end.

CPK Northridge was our favorite restaurant for 7 years till August 7th 2017. I met with car accident on June 17 so I have multiple fracture along with pelvic fractures and right arm fracture, I also have a 5 months old baby. On August 7th around 7 pm  we went out to this CPK for dinner with my husband,my parents and my 5 months old baby for the very first time after the accident.While my family was waiting outside with the baby, I wanted to sit inside and wait, I walked in alone with a cane and body brace, first of all no one opened the door for me even though there was a girl standing at the counter, I understand  they are very busy I didn't mind it. After waiting for 20 to 30 mins finally when they gave us the seat they gave a round table with wooden chairs, with my pelvic fractures it will hurt me to sit on it so I asked the lady ( she took us to the table ) if she can give us a booth with cushion or atleast give cushion on the table for me, for that she said sorry, she cannot give one as they have reservations so cant give me those booths and also cant provide me cushion or better chair as they dont have one. She said I will have to wait again in queue to get a better seat to be available. (I did see empty booths , they gave the booth to the family who came after us) My husband talked to the manager, she said sorry to him and said they cant fit us to that available  booth since we have a stroller and its fire hazard etc, (We could have parked the stroller and just kept the car seat if needed). We had to leave without eating ,we were very disappointed the way they treated a family with a disabled person and a 5 months old infant, I believe they could have definitely done something to help this situation. Also the manager didn't come and say sorry to me . She just watched us leave.So we went to "Yard House" next door for the first time and loved the food and menu, service and of course the seats were very comfortable. I am glad I tried something new they have better vegan options.I dont think I will go back to this CPK. I am mad and very disappointed with them , but glad I discovered a new restaurant because of this incident.
Our server Anthony is a boss, knew the menu well.. promptly brought drinks and was very friendly.

Food was good service was good even though our food took a long time and came out cold, but the waitress took care of us and understood that we where waiting a while so she remade our food came out within 10min. They could better keep track of time people our waiting
Great services. The workers here r so kind. I recommend Lewis to be ur waiter. He's so kind.

Awesome experience here from start to finish. The food was delicious and the service was top notch. We had the classic BBQ chicken pizza, the Thai chicken pizza (awesome!) and the lettuce wraps. To top it all off we had the butter cake which melted in our mouths. Our server Tyler was the best!!!!! He needs to be promoted.

I really like eating at CPK restaurant chains especially here because it's near my home and you get good service.  Also, compared to other restaurants in the area, we always get seated quickly.  I usually go to Claim Jumper first and end up at CPK due to long seating time there.  I'm not complaining the food is delicious. Parking however, can be a little challenging cause it's located next to the mall and is always busy. Tip - have one of your family members or friends get a table while you look for a parking to save on wait time. All of their salads, pasta, and pizzas are delicious. I don't remember a time where I didn't like anything that I've ordered.  My favorite is the cajun jambalaya pasta, gorgonzola pear pizza and chicken Moroccan salad. All highly recommended.  They also have a great dessert menu. I've had their red velvet cake, tiramisu and butter cake with ice creams which are all excellent. I will definitely be back again! Great for large families and kids menu available

I called in to see how busy they were because a friend and I wanted to use the free wifi to use our laptops and do some planning for an upcoming trip. We weren't sure if CPK was a good environment for that type of thing, but honestly starbucks was too cold and too loud and it's rare that restaurants in Northridge have free wifi, surprisingly. Melanie, the manager, answered the phone and was SUPER understanding and set us up with a spacious table for both the food and our stuff! We ordered a pretty hefty meal and didn't feel awkward staying a little longer than usual to finish our planning. Everyone including the hostess and our server were very nice and understanding of the work space we had set up! Melanie even came over to sit with us and thank us for asking about availability to stay longer than usual as using laptops during busy hours can sometimes be a bother for customers and servers. I'm super grateful for everyone's kindness and that we were able to hang out. Thanks guys!

Let me just start by saying... THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! My boyfriend & I always buy the BBQ Chicken Pizza from the frozen food section & it's actually really tasty, so the fresh baked version has to be better, right?!  When we walked in, I was really impressed with the restaurant itself. They have a very open layout, so you don't feel cluttered or crammed at all. Our server's name was Ken, & his service was impeccable! I have no idea how anyone can give him a bad review. I feel that people just find things to complain about.  Seriously, ask for him when you come in! He literally walked us through the entire menu & was  very honest about recommendations from the food to drinks! I ordered the California Crush drink, which was very tasty (& strong) & my better half ordered a beer! They do start out off with yummy bread with oil & herbs for dipping. It's hard to go wrong with that. When it came time to order our food, Ken recommended the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine for myself & the boyfriend ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza with Bacon. Can I just say I love Italian food. It's my absolute favorite ever, but rarely does a dish really top my list. I HIGHLY recommend the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. It is literally one of the best dishes I've ever had. I got it with extra sauce, like Ken suggested, & it was just absolutely delicious. The pizza was ridiculously amazing, as well.  We were going to finish off with Strawberry Shortcake, but Ken wouldn't let us lol. He insisted on trying the Buttercake. All I'm going to say is... holy moly. My mouth is salivating again! After our dinner, we were able to chat with Ken for a moment. We told him we were fairly new to the area & he literally wrote down the best restaurants to go to in the area! I was so appreciative of that, because it can definitely be overwhelming having 15 restaurants every couple blocks! All in all, it was a fabulous dinner. Go... ask for Ken... order the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine with a California Crush to drink... don't forget about the Buttercake... & you will have a fabulous experience! We will be back! :)

Hadn't been here since they changed their menu. Very happy with my meal last night. The iced tea was freshly brewed and tasted great. They serve you bread with a choice of butter or olive oil. The bread is very well baked with the right amount of crunch and softness. The roasted vegetable salad is AMAZING! The veggies are so warm and the dressing is a good compliment. The barbecue pineapple pizza is so good!!!!! The red velvet cake is just heaven on earth. So moist and the Hagan daas ice cream makes it perfect !!!!

I called in for a pick up order and the service was spectacular. The lovely lady on the other end of the phone was so sweet and patient. I mean she did try adding on a bit but it wasn't obnoxious or anything.  I like that they offer curbside pick up. Personally, I wish I would've used this service because they had blocked off the majority of the lot in front of CPK to accommodate the Farmers Market. I completely understand why they did this but the Farmers Market wasn't happening until later and there weren't many people setting up yet. In short it was a hassle and waste of time having to deal with the people and the parking situation especially on a short lunch break, Food/Price I ordered their 10" margarita pizza and added on some red onions for $13. The pizza was light and refreshing with a simple tomato sauce. I thought it was good but probably not worth the $13 price tag. I guess if I was sitting inside and enjoying with good company I could see $13 being reasonable. However, I am rating them on the food itself and lets just say it doesn't say too much. I also ordered a half Caesar salad for $7. The salad was good but nothing special nor unique and really not worth the $7 price tag. Why is a basic HALF salad $7 when I can get a much bigger and better anti pasta, with meat, for about that price at most Italian restaurant  Overall I guess it's an option but you can do better.

This place straight out sucks! Overpriced ! My food was dry and tasteless. My date and I ordered pizza and the chicken Milanese, both were dry and lacked flavor. The only good thing I enjoyed was the artichoke dip and my beer. Never coming back !

I haven't ate here in over a year, but I was craving pizza. I was actually surprised. It was really good. We tried one pizza with honey wheat dough, which was tasty, and another that had spinach and mushrooms, which was splendid.  The service was very good. Wait time, was no more than 5 minutes. The price was not bad either. I will definitely go back. Which reminds me I saw a good deal at Costco. $79 for a $100 gift card. I hope that's still available, because it would make me very happy :)
Nice italian food. Great ambiance. Fantastic Server (Evelyn?)  This branch really serves its customers well.

We came here for a birthday dinner... Our drinks took forever.. Literally like half an hour..  So did the food.. We must have waited literally an hour for the food.. And we got the bread after we got the food.  So when the appetizers came out they were super burnt.. Like you could taste it in every bite. I didn't say anything because maybe they just forgot it for a while.. But the we got our food and everything was just hard and burnt.. We didn't complain but I don't think ill be returning to this location anymore.. Topanga has never disappointed.

BAD BAD BAD SERVICE. My husband and I decided to meet there with my mother-in-law and while she waited 20 mins for us there, they NEVER greeted her nor did they offer to have her seated. We sat ourselves down and the waitress treated US like we were rude for seating ourselves when NO ONE even so much as offered to seat us. The waitress was rude, didn't smile, and acted like she didn't care to serve us. The food was good, however, but I will never go back to ANY CPK restaurants again. I'm taking my money elsewhere!

Sharing my lunch experience today at this location. Dirty plates ( they don't wipe it after  they come out of the dishwasher), confused waitress ( we were the first customers and 2/3 of our orders were incorrect) and flies ( always! Inside or outside there are flies) the manager was kind enough to apologize about the incorrect orders and gave us another pizza on the house. The waitress apologized too, but I didn't understand how she got all the orders mixed up.  Lesson: have them repeat the orders to you before they run to the kitchen!

Came in here for lunch one day, it was busy but nothing crazy.  We were seated in Kenny's section, he's amazing.  He suggested that we get the spinach artichoke pizza, and it was to die for! I recommend this for everyone who likes the spinach artichoke dip.  We got the dip as well and I can't believe I'm saying it but the pizza was better than the dip.  Service was great, everything came out quickly and was delicious.  They have recently remodeled the location, and it looks great.  The floorplan seems to be a bit more open, so you don't seem as crowded in there as you used to.

I had not been to a CPK in sometime and I am starting to wonder why not? This mall location is busy, but well organized and very well staffed. We were seated promptly and our waters were there quickly and service with a smile seemed to be the norm here.   CPK has so many choices but I really think their signature pizza's and salads are their star attractions.  The night we were there they were running a limited selection menu special. One appetizer, two entrees and, one dessert to share for $30.  The choices were reasonable and it sounded like a great deal.   We shared the following and it actually ended up being too much food, the pizza came home nearly in tact.    Appetizer:  Artichoke  dip served with tortilla chips.  This is one heavy appetizer, very filling and quite salty, still good though.  Entrees: BBQ chop salad. I still enjoy this salad and they did not skimp, this was an entree unto itself.  All the goodies are in there, just a touch heavy handed on the dressing.  Margherita Pizza Wow this was a homerun, good enough for Spago's if you drizzled a touch of olive oil on top. Lite, fresh, crispy and chewy at the same time. A real treat and what CPK built their oven fired pizza reputation back day.    Dessert: The Butter Cake  is part cheesecake, part pound cake topped with vanilla ice cream, you do the math, sinful decadent and pure genius.   Very satisfying and pleasant experience and a value to boot. Good job CPK a return visit is eminent.

This is my favorite location of this chain by far. I love the atmosphere and the staff that work here. I always come at least for my birthdays to get my complimentary dessert. I am never disappointed with the quality of food. Yes they are not perfect either and sometimes they take a while or get a drink wrong, but at the end of the day the staff is very polite and the food is of very good quality. I love getting their salsas, pizzas and appetizers but my favorite is still desert. They have a butter pound cake that is to die for. Make sure to add the ice cream and you won't be disappointed. I will definitely be back

This place was awful. We came here for my sister's 18th birthday. There were 10 people in our party.  Our waiter Ken, acted bored and exasperated with us from when we came in. We ordered drinks, and I didn't get mine until 15 minutes after everyone  at my table had gotten theirs. We ordered the spinach dip appetizers and found a very long hair in our dip. So the manager agreed to take it off our bill.  THEN, 45 minutes later we finally got our food.  Our pizzas were cold as were put pastas. The manager came an apologized and brought out new pizzas.  Finally we get desserts and in my mom's strawberry shortcake's whip cream there was a green bean. When we told our waiter, Ken, he responded by saying that it was actually an asparagus not a green bean. And it's because the salad guy also makes desserts. Since we were unimpressed by this fun tidbit, we requested the check and left. This is really upsetting. We had multiple issues and our waiter was absolutely terrible. His apathetic attitude and service left vast amounts of room for improvement.  The manager was sympathetic but generally useless. He took the ruined items off our bill but did nothing to improve the standard of service.  We had 10 people in our party, most ranging ages 18-30 and no one was carded for alcoholic drinks. Our food was contaminated, cold and slow to be served. This was overall terrible experience.

2nd time coming to CPK!~ The first time I was actually really excited because before I moved to California, I used to buy frozen pizzas that were called CPK only because it was BBQ Chicken!!  Even if it was frozen pizza... it tasted good~ So when I found out about this place, I was like "OMGSH! It's the real place" of course that sounds silly.. My first time experience wasn't that great because I think I got sick ... after eating the Chicken Piccata... since it was super oily... Well this review is about my 2nd time experience so here goes! My sister (who is visiting from Washington) and I went inside and were asked our names but the hostess didn't tell us how long it would be... We waited about 5 minutes... (the thing I don't understand is when they have open tables in front of us and no one gets seated there) No need to rush, so I just took in the interior of the place and so far I do like the inside but... only problem is... the low ceiling makes people talking really NOISY... Our server was nice and asked us what we would like to drink and if we wanted any appetizers. Usually when I go to a restaurant the lemonade flavors are strawberry or raspberry but CPK had peach and mango lemonade which threw me off! I asked our server which one tasted better and she suggested the peach lemonade so I gave it a try. Not really better than the raspberry lemonade but I did end up getting a refill :) The actual reason we came here was because last time I came, someone in the group ordered Crispy Mac N' Cheese and I only had a bite of it last time. We ordered it of course and it tasted good :)  Next, I ordered the Pesto Cream Penne with Shrimp minus the Sun-Dried Tomatoes. (I don't like tomatoes) My sister ordered the Four-Cheese Ravioli  (which I actually wanted first... because Ravioli is my favorite!!) Both came out on a decent time and we digged in. I tried the Four-Cheese Ravioli first and my sister tried the Pesto Cream Penne first! We both fell in love with each other's dishes so we switched. I ended up gobblin' up all the ravioli and my sister ate a decent amount of the penne... (except she had penne pasta 3 times this past week...) Our server came around a couple times asking if everything tasted alright and she left with a funny look on her face, probably because we switched our dishes haha. I definately want to come back and eat the Four-Cheese Ravioli again because I even loved the cheesy color of it on top plus the texture of Ricotta is... the best~ I would give it 5 stars... but the noise level.. kind of ruins everything.

Great fast service.  I came on my lunch break, dined in with a coworker. We had time to get there, order, eat, box up left overs, pay and head back to work on time.  I work close but still driving distance. So on that note def giving 5 stars..  I'll be back to enjoy more from one of my favs.

Been to this location TONS of times for years.  Can't think of one complaint.  Nice bar, inside & outside seating.  Fast and friendly service, knowledgable staff.  Our waitress Evelyn was exceptionally good today.   P.S.  I love the the quinoa and arugula salad, have preserved it my last four times at CPK.  My favorite dish there is the Kung Pao Spaghetti (I sub the whole wheat penne instead), SO SPICY & DELICIOUS!

We dine here multiple times a week (on the patio mostly) and absolutely love the food and the service! The manager Angel always treats us like royalty, and Hannah always brightens our day :) Our little infant Tommy loves it there too he always hangs out so peacefully in his stroller  which is always cherished lol. Been to many other CPK's but definitely our favorite for sure!

No matter what I will always love CPK! Our waiter Dylan was an amazing server, super friendly. The only thing that bummed us out was the fact that the restaurant seemed to be very understaffed. It took forever to get our drinks and food. Good thing we came in a big group to keep us entertained while we waited.

What is the point of making a reservation if they give your table away? Lady (Aubrey/Audrey) at the front was rude and should find a different job!! Have always had trouble here! I had a decent time at dinner tonight. The hosts didn't seem to be communicating well. One host pointed to an ideal little booth that my boyfriend and I both excitedly accepted. However, then the other host (who was standing next to the first host) walked us to a different side of the restaurant to a booth next to the bathroom. Of course we asked for the booth we were originally offered and she then had to check if it was available and then walked us all the way back over. We sat and our server was Erik. He was nice and answered every question we had about the menu. Service seemed a bit backed up but we understood that was due to his section being completely packed. We started off with a mango iced tea, strawberry mango cooler, and the avocado egg rolls. The rolls I have to say tasted fine but were actually just one small piece of avocado in the front and none in the rest of it. For our entrees we ordered the chicken piccata and the jambalaya fettucine . The chicken piccata was great. The chicken was moist, and we loved the capers. The jambalaya however left a lot to be desired. We actually ended up sending it back after a single bite each and apologized profusely. The taste just wasn't right and the pasta was way too thick and the textures just didn't go well together in our opinion. We did however get the butter cake for dessert which ended up being absolutely delicious. Erik said it was, "Hands down the best dessert they have." That cake saved the meal.

Tday was served by alana and tyler, trainee. As usual, service is good and to be of reputation of cpk level. My gold standard was the thai chicken pizza n spinach dip as appetizer. I had key lime pie for dessert. I usually this bc the slight tartness cuts the meal heaviness, so save room fir dessert. To freshen the meal, I had mango ice tea. I guess I ordered my comfort food ea time

Nice place and great location near the mall. You can either eat before you shop or treat yourself after.  This place is always busy no matter the time of day. Expect a short wait to be seated. The restaurant is kept nice and clean. Indoor or outdoor seating available. The staff is courteous and friendly. Oh yes free wifi. The day of my first yelp review for CPK they had a short blackout. It was a hot day In the valley. Luckily it was lunchtime.  Started with the chicken ginger dumplings for appetizers. Prepared a little differently it was quite delicious.  Main dish is the garlic cream fettuccine with shrimp. The dish was okay. Need more sauce IMO.  For whatever reason I never seem to have no room for desert. Maybe it's the bread we loaded up on before the food arrived. I'm sure they're quite good. Next time......maybe

I was on my way home last Thursday 6/23 when I noticed that my credit card was missing.  I figured I must've left it there so I called the restaurant. Tanner picked up and transferred me to the manager.  The manager said he had it.  They were closing in 8 minutes (9:30pm) so I asked if I could just knock on the door in case I get there 5 minutes late.  He said he would not be able to let me in after closing.  I don't live in the area and didn't want to have to drive all the way back from home on another day, so I rushed back to the restaurant and ran up to the door at 9:31pm.  The doors were locked.  The restaurant was still full of customers.  I knocked on the door and showed the hostess my wallet, signaling that I left my credit card.  She signaled the manager, who walked to the patio door (next to the locked main entrance where I was standing). He stuck his head and half of his body out of the patio door.  I said i called earlier and just needed to pick up my credit card.  He said I would need to come back tomorrow since he already locked the doors 2 minutes ago and it was a security issue.  I asked if he could just bring the card out to me and he said no.  As inconvenient as it was, I knew he would not accommodate me and I did not want to cause a scene - so I said ok and left.  He had a very unfriendly demeanor, even on the phone.  I suspect that he locked the doors early just to turn me away.  I get that it was my fault for leaving my card there but it would've been much better customer service for him to bring the card out to me or let me in since I called ahead.  It really ruined my experience, and I drove home upset.  I did not understand how it was a security issue to let me in 1-2 minutes after business hours when the restaurant was still full.  Even if he didn't want to let me in, he could've brought the card to me.  He had already stuck half his body out of the patio door so it's not like the place was locked down. I returned on Friday 6/24 to pick up my card.  A different manager was there.  I asked him who the manager from the previous night was.  He said it could be Angel or John.  I really hope that if this is an actual rule, you review exceptions to the rule for customer service purposes.  I submitted a complaint to   that night and also left a comment on the California Pizza Kitchen Facebook page.  It's been 5 days, and I have not received a response.

The worst experience in this Northridge CPK. Not the first time this has happen. everything and everyone was amazing. the only thing I would suggest: the lighting is a bit too dim in the evening, it would be nice to get some more light :b other than that, I loved it.

I walk in wanting to get a delicious pizza and as I walk the host women gives us extremely bad attitude and basically tells us to leave I found that very offensive and disrespectful. Never coming here again!

Had a really bad experience here. Food is was great and that's why it gets 2 stars. My boyfriend and I ordered the fried mac and cheese balls with extra cheese on the side. They were smaller than the ones I get at the Sherman Oaks/Encino Locations...But they were great. We ordered Barbecue Chicken Pizza as our meal & it didn't disappoint.  We went on the night when Farmers Market was open.  Service was terrible. The host was great and Tyler was wonderful but our actual server, Alex, was terrible. When we sat down she said that she was "Sorry", and that she'll be "right with us". A couple minutes passed, and Tyler greets us, and takes our drink and appetizer order. After a busy week and light lunch, I decided to treat my mother and myself to dinner. We had to take a break from our usual eatery. So, I chose something close to home. It has been a long while since I had pizza and I wanted to pick a classy place such as California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) at Northridge Fashion Center. Located at the north side of Northridge Fashion Center and near Macy's. CPK is elegantly designed. We decided to get a booth near the kitchen. My hostess was a cutie named, Megan. I used "My" versus "Our" because I had a liking of her from the start. We started off with our complimentary bread with olive oil & herbs. After devouring our complimentary bread, we ordered a quick appetizer of White Corn Guacamole & Chips ($3.99). Its a simple plate with tortilla chips with a scoop of guacamole. I wish there was more chips and more guacamole. After a quick bite, I ordered the main dish of the night. I was worked up through the day and decided none other than "The Works" Pizza ($13.99). "The Works" consists of mushrooms, pepperoni, sausage, onions, and heck a lot of green peppers. Its hand tossed and the bread was very thin. I ate more of the ingredients than the dough. Now, that's what a pizza should taste like. The meal wasn't greasy and Megan took care of our table. I made a mistake of asking for napkins, but as I mentioned it was not greasy nor it was messy. I ate four slices versus my mothers two slices. However, this meal is rewarding since I have been good in the past couple of years and its time to work harder for 2014. Yelp! The One Stop Place For Your Everyday Research!

Today is veterans day, so I got a free plate of pasta. It wasn't as good as the wording on the menu portrays it. Don't let the delicious words fool your taste buds! I did not feel like complaining and making a bigger deal than what it was, but I am dissapointed with the quality of food, and customer service that was given to me.The sauce was tasteless as was the chicken. It's pathetic how Veterans' get better quality food from a hungry man dinner than a popular resturant. I'll put it this way, my wife paid for her food and she got way better quality food. I'll end there

hmmm I love cpk but I have a couple of complaints.  First they are super overpriced... but I deal with it sometimes if I'm craving.
