It was ok...bigger than I thought.  Not too impressed with their pizza. I think BJ's is way better.  I really don't know why this place gets so packed because their food is really mediocre.
I am not a happy yelper.  We got seated pretty quick. My boyfriend and I ordered a Mac&Cheese appetizer, Kung Pao Chicken Spaghetti, &a Chicken picatta. Our appetizer was delicious. But

I came here during lunch on a weekday and the service took quite a long time (over 30 minutes) even though the place was quite empty. The food here is solid. I ordered the original chopped salad and I was definitely satisfied with it, but I wouldn't say it was anything amazing...

Our waiter was very accommodating and helpful with information on gluten-free options. The pizza surpassed my expectations, and I was truly disappointed that it would all be eaten. But on the bright side, I can come back for more, which I intend to do!
CPK is always a nice place to get a decent meal. Not crazy expensive & you get a nice helping of whatever you order. The waiters are usually really nice & attentive. No complaints!

I'm rating this CPK a 2 because the only good thing about dinner was the company I brought to the table.  The food wasn't bad but it was forgettable; the only reason we went to CPK was because we hadn't ate there in so long we thought it would be a good idea to try it again.  The pizza was good, the kung pao was okay, and other than great company I can't think of a good reason to visit anytime soon.   If I could do it all over again I'd stick to pizza and ignore everything else on the menu.  My guess is doing that would result in a rating of 3 or more.

We came here to break our fast! We had a great start when the waitress spilled a cup of iced tea on me. Yes, she spilled the whole cup. She was quick to get it cleaned up but decided to hide it from the management. My hubby decided to speak up since I was soaked. The manager offered us dessert.....really.....dessert.....then he said that I should call him and let him know if my clothes come out of the wash ok......no thanks!

Nothing can compare to the Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza with lettuce on top. My favorite gourmet pizza. Perfect combination: Gorgonzola cheese, caramelized onions, walnuts, pear and fresh lettuce. It will serve two people or you can eat half and take the rest to-go. My brothers love the Barbecue Chicken Pizza that CPK also sells packaged frozen in grocery stores though it's not my thing. I like that CPK serves bread and butter, but you do need to order some veggies when you're here. Otherwise it's a carb overload.

I had been craving a California Cobb salad for the longest time and couldn't find any friends to go with me because they all can't stand cpk...so when my mom wanted to go I was ready for a yummy salad... Apparently cpk has gone WAY down since the last time I came and I can understand now why none of my friends want to go. The bread and butter were cold (how are you supposed to spread cold butter on cold bread?). Then the strawberry lemonade was WAY too sweet (and I LOVE sweets). Last of all the lettuce in my salad had obviously been frozen and was clear all over (also made it painfully cold to eat although I definitely like a crisp cool salad).   So thank you cpk for fixing my craving for your formally really tasty California Cobb salad! I no longer will have to hunt down a friend to eat here.

I have ALWAYS received the best service here. We walked in, told the host table for 2. He went to call out another guest, but I guess they left so he said "ok I'm seating you guys" so we got seated right away. The plates for our bread were dirty (tsk tsk busboys) so the MANAGER himself came and apologized and brought us new ones. Our server Elizabeth (wonderful blonde girl) also came and apologized. We weren't even mad haha, shit happens right? It was a busy night.  The manager came back again and said that dessert was on the house because of the mishaps but really we weren't even tripping cause we could read the menu just fine, plate were brought to us immediately, and that's what matters right? Elizabeth was also kind enough to bring my boyfriend and I a candle because they could not find someone to replace the light without them like...standing over our food/table. Very sweet of her and very fitting as we were having a date night!!! Split a margherita thin crust pizza and a pesto penne pasta with chicken with my boyfriend.Our faves.  Food was brought out in a timely manner and DELICIOUS. Elizabeth came by and checked on us (and her other tables)  VERY frequently. Fantastic server!!  We got to pick our dessert and of course red velvet cake was the first thing out of my mouth haha!! Thank you to the manager and Elizabeth for making our night wonderful!! We left a very generous tip for their kindness and truly phenomenal customer service.

Chicken and shrimp lettuce wraps and BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad were amazing as always! I am now gluten free and had not eaten at a CPK in a few years because they didn't have gluten free pizza. I tried the gluten free pizza that they have now, but unfortunately they don't cook it correctly like a lot of other places. Burnt edges and not completely cooked in the middle. So, I'll take it home and cook it some more. :S

First time here,  GREAT SERVICE! Everybody was very friendly and welcoming. Overall the food was delicious, the restaurant was very nice and clean, and our server was sooo sweet. Loved it, will be coming back soon.

CPK why!!!!!!  You are my kids n i favorite. I keep giving you chances because my kids love you. Today you killed me. What bothers me is that you spoil me with an amazing  spicy chicken Chipotle pizza  (thin crust) with extra bean salsa, avacado, bacon. Ooooo my right! ?!?!? The way i got it was crunchy on the outside and raw n the middle. They tried again n the same. I really was looking foward to this pizza. It's amazing when done right. Yes but why cant you continue to spoil me!?!?!?!? Is it the waiter that makes a difference???? Maybe???? Ralphy at your northridge location always makes it right!!! This waiter for what ever reason was really cold. Explained twice how i wanted it and nothing.  If you want killer pizza every single day i guess it can't be California pizza kitchen. Ive been coming here for the past 3 years.  I'm loyal but after today i think i need to find a new pizza spot. California pizza kitchen why! ?!?!??

My go to restaurant on mondays... Chicken Milanese is the best thing other than their amazing pizzas... the service is awesome, the waiters/waitresses are always professional, no complaints about this location...

Stopped by for a quick Friday night dinner with the hubbs! Haven't really visited this joint since 5 yrs ago... Nothing to really complain about... Same food and good service! Dnt know why the ratings is so bad. Will visit again!
Good food fast service good team work we got the best server thanks Ericka so friendly and has good suggestions on food always checked on us

Last night a friend and I went to have a meal at the Northridge CPK. Whenever at CPK I always order the same thing, chicken tequila fettuccine. Last night my friend and I got my usual and it was great! Not sure if there was a new cook or maybe they added a little something different but we ate every last bite, and I never finish my meal. My friend even mentioned how much she loved it. Also, the restaurant was extremely busy and we still got good service!  I usually don't post, but last nights meal definitely deserves a good rating!  Overall, a great experience!

Located in the Northridge fashion center with ample parking right out side. It's a chain restaurant, so keep that in mind. The complimentary bread is now baked, and comes with dipping oil. Not bad. Ordered the avocado egg rolls. Not as good as Cheesecake factory, but pretty tasty. Favorite salad is the cobb, and the half portion is perfect for lunch. All very fresh ingredients. BBQ pizza is what they are known for, and it is fairly decent. Service is spotty at best. Some days the servers are very attentive, and some days you wonder why they showed up. Download the app on your phone and accumulate free food and discounts. Great place to take the kids because it's loud, but other than that, I wouldn't go out of my way.
Good, fresh salads. Service was okay. Bread/crust on our pizza was extremely tough. We ate the toppings off and left the rest. Not impressed.

This is mine and my sister's go to place when we just wanna have lunch. I'd say its really a toss up for good or bad service. I will say though, that the only time that we have been seated outside the service was definitely terrible. I understand that having guests outside might be a little tough, but seriously, we sat through the entire meal without having our waters refilled once, and the only time we saw our waitress was when she took our order, brought our food, and gave us our check. My advice for all you guys would be to sit inside, even if the wait is longer, it usually isn't as long as they say. It's totally worth it to sit inside! As for the food, I've tried just about everything on their menu. Like I said, its my go to place! My favorite is the chipotle pizza! it has chicken and this pico de gallo mixture on top of it, and it comes drizzled with cilantro and lime sauce that is soooo delicious! I ALWAYS ask for a side of that sauce! Other mentionable pizzas would have to be the habanero carnitas, tostada, and spinach artichoke pizza. They have a small cravings menu with is alright, but it is what it says, small. The chicken quesadilla, is pretty good, but for $5.00, you could just make it at home lol. The macaroni bites, and korean tacos are also pretty good!  As for drinks, the lemonades are usually on the sweet side, but good to have every now and then. The coladas are pretty good at this location, too! The only drink I'd advise against would be the cherry limeade, I was thoroughly disaapointed. I felt so bad because I kept asking the waiter to fix it, until I finally gave up after probably the 4 glass?  Anyways, if you've never been to CPK, you should definitely go! and try the chipotle pizza! (: just don't sit outside lol and if you are starving when you get there, just ask for bread while you wait. Apparently, they're not allowed to serve the free bread unless you ask for it, lame right?

Had a very annoying dinner here. We waited in line for 25 mins and we got to our table, It was going great till our waitress started ignoring us and gave all her time and attention to the other tables. Had to flag down other waiters for things. THANK GOD for management.  Manager Chris was very helpful and ran right to me to help anyway he can. That is service!

I came to this CPK for the second time and the food is delicious, they keep the restaurant clean, and the waiters and waitresses are very polite with customers. But the second time I went I found a piece of hair in my salad. I told the waitress and the manager came to apologize, she was very understanding and nice. I ordered a tortilla soup instead and they said they were going to pay for my lunch. So my lunch was free. Besides finding a hair on my salad, everything was great.

It isn't cheap, but the food is fresh and good. I got the Cobb Salad and BBQ chicken pizza. The pizza is good, but it's odd to have a sweet pizza (from the BBQ sauce, I guess). The salad is good and fresh. I like their blue cheese dressing. I would eat here more often, but it's just pricey; otherwise, I have no complaints.

The hostess seated us quickly during the lunch rush on a Sunday.  The wait staff was on top of their game - orders came out quick, all of our drinks were full, etc.  Food was typical CPK quality - you know why you're here.  My current favorite is the white pizza.  The sourdough bread is good too - remember to ask for it pre-meal, because they don't automatically bring it out anymore.

I've visited this location a couple of times with friends and family for lunch and dinner I don't have any complaints of anything. The service has been great, and the food is excellent. Some of their dishes are a little bit pricey. but the food they serve Is worth the price. Yes, I will comeback many times for lunch or dinner. I had the salmon on a  cedar plank  with vegetables on the side, every thing was totally delicious.

I think Might be a little bias only because CPK is one of my favorite restaurants!!! I love their tostada pizza, butter cake with ice cream and their avocado egg rolls are the best!!! It's what I always get, I've tried almost everything on the menu but that my absolute favorite thing there!!! But my experience at this specific CPK has always been a good one!! Their waiter, hostess, and mangers are super friendly and kind!! Defiantly recommend it!!!

We placed a 16 person order in today with CPK, what a handful that must have been at high noon lunch time. I had ordered extra sauce with my eggrolls but they must have forgot them, since I didn't get any at all.  I called and spoke with Charlene, who was very helpful and connected me to the manager on shift " Rebecca". The manager was so nice and gave me the most wonderful customer service. She sent someone over right away with my sauces.  We all drop the ball and make mistakes, but it truly shows who you really are when you pick the ball back up again without hesitation or someone even having to ask you.
Excellent customer service, Stephanie was great very attentive and sweet. My guess and I order a Bbq chicken pizza and Pennie pesto pasta with shrimp.
They have some good pizza. I had a spicy buffalo chicken pizza and it was good. Also I had a new drink of strawberry and mango drink.

This place was great, i came in with my friend last night to try it out after the movies. The waiter was friendly, he gave us the run down of what their place has to offer. The drinks available are amazing! Done with great care. The pizza was good as well. It seemed small but it was very filling for the both of us. The strawberry shortcake was to die for. It was so fluffy and moist, full of flavor aside from the whipped cream though. Lol. I'll be back to try their humus and another pizza
Great time here. The food was good. The butter cake is the best. We definitely will order this cake to go!!

Got there at 1 pm lunch time went straight to the bar thinking its gonna be fast the bartender took my order ar 1:20pm got my food at 1:45pm and didnt have time to eat so got it to go never coming back to this location again
Great cpk location!!! Bartenders are super nice :) one of my favorite locations.  Try the sangria!!!

The food is always good.  Our server was a little on the... unknowledgeable side.  She kept having to confirm things with her manager.  How embarrassing.  Other than that, our visit this time around was pleasant.

Best customer service ever!!!! We went there on a Tuesday afternoon but it was pretty full. I ordered the new garlic roasted chicken. It was really pricy and the quality didn't respond to the price! The plate looked great in the menu but it wasn't really worth cuz it was different when it came out! I loved the staff,  they were really nice.

The only reason this is getting two stars is because of the wonderful service from Ashtyn. The manager on duty, Shayda, was very unprofessional and rude.  My brother and I  both ordered drinks (both over 21), and we were asked for our id's.  We are both from out of state, and have different looking licenses (New York changed their design and material shortly after I received mine).  Ashtyn checked ours, and took our orders, but then Shayda came out to double check.  She was rude about the way she questioned my id, and then proceeded to ask how old I was, and then asked where I got my license, and acted as if she was extremely experienced in knowing what out of state licenses looked like.  I understand the right to decline people, but there was no need for her to have an attitude with me and be accusational.  I'm very disappointed in the service I received tonight.  I have been in California for six months now and have been to other CPK locations, and this was the first time that I have been denied alcohol.  It definitely ruined the celebratory mood my brother and I had, as we were celebrating my birthday this week.  I do not plan on returning to that branch due to this incident.

They always have a large selection for pasta and pizza to make everyone happy. This location is close too the theatre and mall which is nice. It is a typical California Pizza Kitchen, if you haven't been there, you must try it at least once. Try the Chopped Salad and the TWO in a BOWL.

I usually eat at their Westfield Topanga restaurant which is perfect. I tried here today and was surprise with the low customer service quality. The girl who helped us with our seats were very rude. Our waiter showed us attitude when I asked to make sure that my our food comes together. The wait time was too much although they had normal number of customer. If you want to eat at CPK , this is not a good one.

I truly enjoyed CPK and I had a great experience last night!  Besides eating delicious tortilla soup! I ordered takeout and Janeen took my order and brought my small order to Curbside! She was so kind and friendly and I really appreciated it!  There food is always fresh, delicious, and the service is great!

I'll start off by saying I would never choose to come here. My friends wanted to go, so I was nice and tided along. Now they post the caloric intake of their items, it makes choosing food more difficult (haha). I DO like their vegetable goat cheese wheat crust pizza. Their salads are OK, too, but you have to be careful about what they pile on (if you are worried about calories). We had a weird issue with this location - apparently we couldn't have a booster stool next to the table inside - we had to use a booster seat (which is OK, but be warned if you have little ones).

Okay, so went here to get my family some good pizza I've only heard awesome things about this place, so why not try it out. The place itself looks really nice and clean You guys are doing it right. The problem for me is the value Value to me is if I feel like I got something good out of it Whether cheap, expensive, in between, whatever So long as I can say, "Yes, it was worth that much or better" I ordered $40 for like 3 pizza's And they were not that big and I am sad to say, not that good Pizza is cheap to make and you can sell it for a good profit For $40, it should have been either BIGGER or the best pizza I've ever had Since it was neither, I saw and see low value Oh and I sat there for little over 30 minutes. Not normally a compliant for me cause there is A LOT that happens in the kitchen that we the common consumers don't know about, but it wasn't all that busy when I came in =/ probably won't be back, but who knows

Three stars because the food is enjoyable as is the patio. The issue that prompted me to only give three stars instead of four is the service. Not unpleasant by any means but definitely not well trained today. We split a salad between two people but the server didn't think to bring us an extra plate. When we asked for one we got a weird awkward look and attitude from her. Then we asked her to split the check and she she forgot. With all the new and upcoming restaurant activity in this area, the service needs to improve to be competitive.
Great food and the staff is the friendliest I've dealt with anywhere! I highly recommend this CPK.
Had a very good experience at the Chamber of Commerce lunch there the other day. Food was really tasty, and the manager and the assitants were great. May use them for some catering.
Best service at the bar! They have a girl forgot her name who is the most sincere and attentive server I've ever had!

California Pizza Kitchen is that restaurant that seems to scream "I'm a tourist and came to LA to eat at CPK" to me but I still will come here because I am a sucker for their pasta with broccolini. The service is always decent, nothing stellar, but it really depends on the server.  One thing that really bothers me is that when they serve you bread, they do not melt the butter so it's very hard to spread onto the bread and enjoy the deliciousness. :(

Went here Wed for lunch after shopping with my friend. Our waiter Danny was great. He was friendly, and made suggestions sine it was out first time at a CPK. The caesar shrimp salad was nothing special. The bread and dessert(chocolate souffle) however was great! I had one of the best margarita's of my life! LOL. If they have a happy hour I will be back for some  more drinks. The waiter charged me twice, and I am still waiting for the credit on  my card. All in all, a decent place with nice outdoor eating,

Absolutely love California Pizza Kitchen. My family loves this location... We have been coming here for years and the service has always been excellent. Some of the staff even know us by name. I love everything from this place, pizzas, sandwiches, and to our surprise our kids favorite thing is the artichoke dip. You  can't go wrong with CPK.

Waited 20 min for someone to introduce them selves as our waitress and still nothing. I had three children who patience was wearing quickly.  9:00 pm on a Sunday with s small amount of guest and I still could get a waitress. I was so frustrated, I had to walk out. By the time we got to another restaurant almost everything was closed had to feed my kids cereal at home. Never AGAIN

I called to order food to go and they said they take the last orders at 8:30pm because they close at 9pm.  I called at 8:32pm!!!!! REAAALLLY!!!  I say take the extra drive to go to the CPK off Topanga Canyon.  They know how to treat their customers.  That same night I was able to place the to go order at 8:45pm at the Topanga Canyon location even though they were also closing at 9pm. Also the food at the Topanga Canyon location is much better!

I was so mad when I ordered over 60 dollars worth of salads and pizzas.  One of personal pizzas I ordered was cheese.  The box had a cold pizza that tasted like cardboard and topped with just a little tomato sauces.  NO Cheese.  Nothing ...nada. Check your order before leaving when you order take out..  I ordered but someone else picked it up so  I had no way of knowing what was in the box.   What a disappointment.  Never order from here again!!!
Good service and the avocado rolls were great but the fettuccine came out way too hard seemed like thy boiled it for 1 minute and have us another one but came out hard again it was a good dinner
Just ate California kitchen and the tequila fettuccine was amazing. It's yummy.  Customer service is great too.

Came here for a co-workers graduation lunch.  Never been to a CPK before.  We ordered bread which took like 10minutes to get (seriously).  The waiter would come around saying the bread is being baked in the oven.  I would think they would know that IT'S LUNCH TIME and there should be bread ALREADY in the oven so when customers request some they will come with the bread at the same time the drinks are coming to the table.  Who's with me on this idea? Anyways everyone orders salad but me and my other co-worker decided to try the Chile Relleno.  I know.  Who the hell orders a chile relleno at CPK?  Well I do ok lol.  The chile relleno was not cleaned out properly.  The vein and seeds were still inside.  It was stuffed with chicken, cheese, corn, and an avocado type sauce.  I don't know why I assumed it would come with like a side of rice or something but nope.  We seriously just got ONE chile relleno in our plate.  It made us laugh but YES I ate it.  Now by this time we had asked for more bread for our table and I had to tell the waiter to bring more than one plate of bread.  Again we were all hungry.  Gong back to my chile relleno.  It was actually pretty good.  The sauce and chicken all were in harmony.  It would have been exceptional if the dam seeds and vein wasn't in it but I wasn't about to make such a big deal of that.  The salads that my other co-workers ordered actually looked very good *note to self order something American at CPK next time.* Our waiter was cool.  Very accommodating to our group.  However, they do not have any lunch specials so $10 for a freaking chile relleno was way to expensive and it wasn't even impressive.

I come here very often and I have never encountered a problem. I came in a few days ago and the week before that and the waiters and waitresses plus the hostesses were phenomenal and very kind. Place is fairly clean. Food is great.

The dining atmosphere is quite pleasant! They have great food but somewhat pricey considering their small portion size. However, what is innovative is that they give out free prize cards usually during the summer which you cannot open until your next visit. These prize cards can help you win big earnings or discounts off your next visit to CPK. Pizzas there are also very exotic as they have many different flavors (e.g. bbq chicken, Mexican pizza, Italian pizza, etc.). Overall, great place if you are looking to not eat as much and try extraordinary food!!

I went there last Saturday at around 2 pm with my two kids. The food was ok but was ruined by the horrible service.  Ken the server came by our table and said nothing...didn't introduce himself, not a hello, nothing. We asked for our drinks and bread first but instead of getting it for us, he went next to the TV and watched the basketball game for a good 5 minutes.  I mean...really??  Then my daughter specifically asked for tiny tiny tiny sauce on her cheese pizza but it was drenched in sauce with big chunks of tomatoes on them.  When he wasn't watching TV, he was flirting with a bunch of teenagers at the next table so we always had to grab his attention whenever we need help.  That server totally ruined our afternoon.  I will not come to this CPK again.

We usually like coming to CPK but something has changed and it's not all good. They updated their menu which is great. My 2 stars are for the quality of food and overall food experience. Two weeks ago, my hubby and I go in for a quick bite. I'm not starving so I order the lettuce wraps. The server comes over and apologizes because they're out of lettuce??? Tonight we go in with the family. 3 of us order the chicken Milanese, I order the lettuce wraps and soup. Server comes over 5 minutes later, they're out of chicken to make the Milanese??? The family orders pastas which we hope they can accommodate. When our meals arrive, the actual chicken mixture for my lettuce wrap smells microwaved. Like they popped it in the microwave a little too long so the chicken pieces are dry and stuck together. The sauce for the wraps is over seasoned. It was not good at all. What's happened to CPK? All that revamping to have food quality issues and how do you run out of food items on your menu??? Twice in a matter of 10 days? Thanks but no thanks CPK.

I like this place, its' a chain restaraunt, but the pizza is good. I ordered the "Mupesa" on wheat, mushrooms, pepperoni and sausage (Mupesa). Got there early and seated fast, great service, and I would say consistent. I ate the whole thing, so good!!! I like this place!!
We came in last week and had a really great server. He checked on us often, was really nice, and even updated us on our points. Great service for a windy day.

I don't come here that often, the food isn't too bad but they add sugar to EVERYTHING, even the pizza had a sweet undertone, the dressings for the Thai salad and the chicken lettuce wraps were full of sugar.  They took the best thing they ever had off the menu which was the carnitas pizza with the habanero salsa.  Wont be going back anytime soon.

I've been here a couple times (to this location) and it's an okay experience.  Food is alright and the place is really nice.  It's located inside the mall, on the bottom floor below the food court. It's usually really busy and it's turned me off before --- I remember one time they ran out of pizza dough.  But service is always decent....the food is good, just not really spectacular.   I recently got take-out for and it was a definite 3 outta 5 based on the food alone.   Shrimp scampi fettuccine is okay- heavy on the lemon (which I usually love) but it kinda hides all the other flavor hidden there.   The asparagus spinach pasta was not very good.  It just tasted ok - kind of like they mixed the flavors together but it didn't all taste like one dish.   The mushroom pizza was the best.  I've been to CPK (at other various locations) since high school pretty much and have some pretty tasty memories of their popular pizzas.  I might stick to the pizza here instead of the pastas.

I love bringing my grandma here she's a big fan. The tequila chicken is always delicious and exact. We appreciate the consistency and that's why we always come back. The service can be hit or miss but the food makes it worth it.

My wife and I came in for lunch. First time at this restaurant. It took more than 30 mins to get our food. When I received my food, the pizza was as cold as my salad. It didn't look fresh. It looked like it was sitting out a while. The only good thing was our waiter Mike. He made sure our drinks where full and also brought us more bread. Don't think I will coming to this place especially if we receive poor food quality. @califopizzakitchen @cpk
Service sucks... Been here before a big group and that group got there food before us and I'm still waiting over an hour for pasta. Ridiculous

CPK is just a place that's easy to go to and expect reasonably good food and prices.  I had the chili relleno which was suprisingly good (definitely not authentic but much healthier).  My daughter ordered chicken Milanese at another CPK, which was listed under pastas but turned out to be a salad (go figure).  She wanted it again but on a bed of spaghetti instead of a bed of greens, and the waitress said no problem. Quite happy with dinner.

CPK is CPK, always tasty....but this review is strictly for our server, Hannah!! Talk about amazing service, great personality, very attentive and overall awesome!!!  Thank you for the wonderful service! You Rock!!

Came today with my mom for a lunch date. She had brain surgery a couple of months ago, and hasn't gotten out much. I thought she would enjoy going to a restaurant with a cool vibe. Upon entering, the servers were accomodating considering we needed extra space due to my mom's surgery complications. Once seated, a server in training greeted us with her trainer and introduced herself. We ordered the mac and cheese bites, Hawaiian pizza, and creamy garlic fettuccine, and loved it. Drinks were never empty, and smiles were always there. Can't wait to come back!

Came here for dinner the other night and thanks to my wonderful waitress 'Katarina' my experience was so amazing! She was so nice and welcoming and knew pretty much the entire menu so she helped me choose a really yummy meal!! She's pretty cute too..(: anyways, LOVE THIS CPK LOCATION! Super hot staff. Thanks Katarina ;)

We came here for a quick lunch before a meeting. We were seated right away. We each ordered salads and the server was very pleasant. My complaint was about the food. Both of us had brown lettuce. The egg on my salad was all yolk. Probably only good for pizzas at this location.
Been coming here a few times with friends it's a good environment with good service and food is decent I will come here time to time for my pasta fix

Came in on a busy Friday night with some friends. We were immediately greeted by Julia who offered us water right away. When she returned with our water we placed our drink and food order. I ordered the tequila chicken at her suggestion.  Man it was  ! Then I ate a butter cake cause I'm super fat and it's super delicious.  I throughly enjoyed my meal and my experience at cpk! Thanks julia! Update: Where's julia? I moved out of the area for a while and when I came back to see my favorite server she doesn't work there anymore! Sad face. Ended up getting some take out with the help of Tanner. He was great! And offered me everything I would need with my order without me having to ask.

I love the food and the waiters are great. I think they could work on their customer service when it comes to take out. I called and ordered my food 30 mins in advance and my pick up time was 12:50. I got there 10 mins late on purpose so I wouldn't have to wait. I didn't get my food until 1:10. It was ridiculous. As I got to work to eat my lunch, the buns for my crispy chicken sandwich were super hard and stale
A really third rate outlet.  The staff just hangs out and the food is extra bland, even for CPK.

CPK is a great place to drop in & grab lunch or dinner with good service & food as expected. A highlight would be their italian chopped salad (my wife's favorite) & their crispy tasty pizza's. They're always ready to customize my pizza for me, too!! Great to come in summer on Wednesdays, have a bite & then cruise the farmer's market for goodies for the home.  Here's the hint, CPK gift cards are available lots of places so you can save a bit. We buy CPK cards thru the Lyoness program  & get cashback. It's a free program & we save at lots of other places too!!
The menu has really chnged not much pizza, smh. They did add the option to put 2 eggs on your pizza so im giving ot a whirl.

I cannot believe the wonderful experience I had here. To begin with, our server was a young lady by the name of Alex. Her personality was very warm and outgoing. Her service and attentiveness was that of a fine restaurant. Of course, I had to compliment her to the managers, Melanie and Angel. Again, both were very warm and pleasant. These 3 people made such an impression on me, I had to share somewhere. The food was a 4, the service beyond a 5.

We are regulars for the past 10 years, and we love the Staff and environment. Not anymore. This is the OFFICIAL BURIAL OF CPK in my book. The food is the problem. Something terrible has happened to the pizza in the past year(s). The pizza are smaller, have a lot less meat toppings... as in 6 pieces of chicken on the whole darned pizza. It's so bad, we will probably not set foot in there again. EVER. We paid $27 last time ... we could have spent $9 at Pieology for WAAAY more food!!

great service waitress was a bit quick and getaway type, but brought the food and took our orderer fast even on a busy saturday afternoon hostess and other waitress were nice too today i ordered the white pizza with bacon; it was, good, very cheesy which i love, but a bit salty; not sure if from the cheese or bacon; the spinach also had an odd taste to it, kinda bitter as it had been over cooked or old my girlfriend ordered the tequila chicken; it's her favorite and it was great! though it seemed  a bit smaller of a portion than when we ordered it for takeout, odd we also ordered the mac n cheese appetizer as a 'side dish' with the meal; i did not realize it was essentially 'fried' mac n cheese balls, but it was very good, creamy and cheesy!  for drinks i ordered the peach iced tea, sweet and refreshing and girlfriend ordered the  strawberry lemonade, sour and refreshing not a fantastic experience at this location but could have been better but i love CPK and shall return

We love it here.  We have eaten here at least once a week for several years.  My husband likes to sit at the counter and watch sports.  The service is fantastic.  They remember what we order, refill his tea without asking and the food is great!  The same servers have been working there forever, which says a lot about how they treat their employees!

I don't usually rate chain restaurants.  The food at CPKs is always acceptable and often imaginative in planning, but conservative in execution.  The food always seems interesting at first and then it seems like you've had it before.  At this particular CPK (which has excellent service) I ordered a Mai Tai which is a featured cocktail.  I am an aficionado of The Mai Tai and this one was downright bad.  It came down specifically to the rum(s) that were used.  Nasty stuff whatever it was.  I usually don't go to CPKs, because the food is deceptively generic.  If you must go, order wine or beer or a soft drink or water if you go.

Worst service and lunch. Let me start with our server. I don't think it is too much to ask to have you come by and ask how everything is or fill my drink.  If you think asking about a refill when you bring my bill and I am ready to go, you are sadly mistaken. Also, if someone asks for more dressing for their salad, please be sure to bring the right one. Nothing sucks more than adding the wrong dressing to your already wretched salad. Oh and don't try to pass off Del Monte canned peaches as 'carmelized' for your carmelized peach salad. Considering you can buy an avocado at the store for 0.99 cents, charging $2.50 for barely a quarter of one is outrageous!

I've had some mixed reactions to this place. I've had wrong orders along with mediocre service, and wonderful attentive service other times. But their food is pretty good, depending what you get. I was surprised how good their fish tacos was (who would expect that at a pizza place?)

Located next to a crappy mall that seems to be getting more and more ghetto.  Gross.  Also making it an ideal place for a lot of younger kids to come and dine..they're useless banter gets on my nerves, but I guess that can't be avoided. They're service is decent. I love the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine but for some reason this location can't seem to get it right.

So we came here on a Wednesday afternoon for a quick lunch before I headed to the mall to find the perfect bridal lingerie for my cousin's wedding. I ordered my all time favorite Miso Salad...which they used to offer a combination of crab and shrimp and now it's only shrimp, their 3 cheese and basil pizza, and the white corn guacamole as an appetizer. Let's just say that the 'guacamole' was more like a half a cup of corn with a hint of avocado. Quite the disappointment but what can you expect from a $4 appetizer? I would think a decent portion of guacamole but I was wrong. =| DARN! The salad was great, everything I had expected the Miso Salad to taste like and for $15, it better be. They were very generous about the shrimp which was a plus since I love shrimp. I was surprisingly impressed with the pizza. I will definitely order that again since it wasn't too heavy but tasted amazing nonetheless. It was a great meal/experience....until I noticed a lady bug in my salad. Now here is the thing, though any insect in my food is absolutely disgusting, I was not grossed out about the lady bug. Maybe because it is red and cute and not nasty looking like an ant or a cockroach..*shivers*. We discretely pointed it out to our waitress, who was exceptionally nice throughout the entire meal, and she took it to the back. I didn't think it was necessary to make a big deal about it and cause a scene since it is not their fault a lady bug flew in my salad. Now if it was any other bug...I would have ran to the bathroom. I believe that lady bugs are a sign of good luck so I was kinda excited/enticed by it? I don't know.  Anyway, the managers came in and apologized for the extra ingredient in my salad. They explained to us that the vegetables are not sprayed with pesticides so sometimes bugs do get on it. I guess they didn't catch it when they were making my salad. Oh well. I had assumed they would comp my salad but they actually comped our entire meal. It was very nice of them to do that since I wasn't really disgusted by what happened. It was definitely an interesting experience. So we had a free meal, but left a very generous tip for our waitress. She was great. The kicker was as we were going out, I overheard the manager tell the chefs, "Let's not garnish our salads with lady bugs." Ahahaha, that definitely made my day. Now on to my day of good luck...I found the perfect lingerie for my extremely blessed cousin at Frederick's of Hollywood for half off. They were the only store that catered to women with gigantic bosoms. I also scored an amazing dress for $20(for the same cousin) from June's, right across from Frederick's. And on my way back to the car, I stopped by at Borders and found a book that I have been looking for, for years, for just $4.  Thanks lady bug!

When grading or reviewing food chains, it is more about quality, cleanliness and service than food. But if you are wondering, food at this CPK is great. I am sad they don't have the Mango Tandoori Chicken pizza. But they have added some interesting new items on the menu (check out my quick tip for menu recommendations). Service here was good and the server was cordial and quick. The ambience and seating is a lot better than other CPK's with ample parking (due to proximity to the mall), plenty of booths and tables inside to accomodate families and large parties. Overall, it is a clean restaurant, with good food, service and ambience for families and large groups.

I was here today! Ordered their new shrimp appetizer it was so good you have to try it! And of course my favorite pizza from them is their Sicilian. Delicious and good service today as well.. I will say the bread was a little "dryer" than usual but other than that it was a great day to eat outside!

Been to CPK many times and enjoyed it... This last time sucked. Server was doing the take out and serving us. Food took too long after we placed the order. Blamed the kitchen being behind. No manager came by to acknowledge the slow delivery so we figured the server just forgot to order our food. Ordered the tortilla soup which was cold and tasted like mush, looked like baby food. Had a pepperoni pizza which was great. I would like to have had some Parmesan and hot pepper seeds. Couldn't get anyone's attention. Would have liked to have refills on our beverages. The server did ask if everything was satisfactory, we were more than half way through, so we said fine. Thanks for checking. The server did have the soup taken off the check but still no manager visit. Update: Assistant GM reached out and contacted us via email. Apologized and invited us back to try them again, we will soon.

I love cpk. I would suggest the Hawaiian BBQ pizza if you like BBQ and pineapples. The chicken isnt dry or undercooked it's perfect. The fettucini Garlic cream is good but the pasta itself was a little hard and not as soft as I thought it should be.

We have been going here for years.  The service is getting worse, the bathroom are always a disaster, the food is not that great anymore.  The pizza is good (our kids love it, which is why we keep going) and the Veggie salad is great.  Most of the other menu items are nothing special and over priced.

Two disappointing lunch meeting in one month - I'm done with CPK.  I've eaten at CPK for year, but this one isn't too good.  The pizza isn't fully cooked (the bread is doughy) and it didn't come to us very hot (luke warm at best).  They didn't offer us bread, we had to ask.  The service was okay at best.  They no longer sell the Rosemary Chicken Pizza, which was my favorite. I am no longer enamored with CPK.  The last time we ate at the one in Woodland Hills, it was okay (3 stars), but the one in Northridge is unacceptable.  There are many other choices in the mall or in the area.  Heck, Claim Jumpers is right across the parking lot.  And Wood Ranch is right around the corner.

Nice service here. Food is good..  I always call ahead and put my name in before I get there. When I arrive, they usually seat me right away or within a couple mins. I have never had a problem with this restaurant and would recommend the sicilian pizza here.   The only thing I don't like is the bread they serve you as you wait. They used to serve much better bread. The new CPK in Topanga mall serves much better bread and oil with your bread.

I like cpk. it's my to-go-to restaurant every time I don't feel experimental. this past weekend, we went in the early afternoon and everything was pretty good. as we walked in, it smelled like old carpet though.  We sat at a booth as requested right away. Server was nice. we tried a couple of their new mini appetizers and I gotta say the itty bitty artichoke heart bites were very tasty. then we shared the italian tomato and basil pizza on their thin crust. no one should order pizza on their regular crust here. thin crust is just to die for. pizza was good as always.  overall good experience. Not great, but good. That's why they get 3 stars.

CPK, I've got a bone to pick with you. Everytime I come to this location my plates are dirty, especially the bread plates. No, not like theres a piece of wool or something on my plate, theyre GREASY with food left on them. unacceptable and disgusting. I either send back the plates every single time, or I just don't use them.  Fuck, maybe the tables cleaner, who knows. They've gotten a B rating three times, each time about a week or so later, it gets changed to an A (I work at the mall, so I'm aware). Make your own inductions about that one. I've noticed their quality of food has gone down significantly in the past two years, while the price has gotten higher. Great. Salads don't taste that fresh anymore. I'd much rather prefer BJs or Fridays or Cheesecake. I think the only thing that good is the DOUGH for the pizza (don't get excited, just the dough.). I've given you enough chances CPK, you little "oh heres some stale bread to go with your meal". WARM IT UPPPPPPPP, why do you have that fucking fire going on in the middle of your kitchen for anyways?!? Stop asking me if i want avocado in my salad, i hate avocado.

Shared the Miso salad and Carne Asada pizza with the wife here before a movie last night.  The salad was great, pizza was good, but not great.   The salad had a miso dressing with enough crumbled wantons for an interesting flavor, and a perfect amount of crab and shrimp.   It's a little noisy, but I love the menu.  My only complaint is that they dropped our favorite "Tandoori Chicken" off.  Their pizzas definitely stand out from the competition - great variety, fairly healthy choices - it's great to have a pizza that's not soaked in grease. A small salad and a pizza are perfect for two to split.  With a drink it might be $15-20 each out the door.
The salad tasted like a cleaner or metal of some sort, - could not have been good, and the soup was sour. If it had been one bad item I may have gone back but two is a loser.

Very disappointed with the new changes in the pizza crast recipe, it lost the unique sweet tast:( Now it is so generic, you would not even recognize BBQ chicken pizza at all. Cranchy T.salad was not crunchy and portion wise very small. Need to look for some other place for lunch in a future unfortunately.

I like California Pizza kitchen. They have alot more drink options than alot of places- smoothies, coladas, lemonades, limeades, slushies, teas, coffees, wines. I've always been a big fan of drinks and i appreciate all their options as i feel like more places should have them. The first place i look on the menu is the beverage section, and if soda, water, and afew beesr or wines are the only options it sort of makes me a sad panda lol ^.^ their pizza is different but in a good california-home-BBQ way. This is my aunts favorite place to go in the area because they have really good and unique salads. The portions are always good. My aunt got a full BBQ chicken salad with avocados and garbanzo beans without tortilla chips *strange that you have to add garbanzos if you want them like avocado*, it's her favorite. i got a half carmelize peach salad with salmon and avocado. My grandmother got fetticini alfredo. Their alfredo is much lighter and less saucey but in a really good way. I only eat half of the half salad as the portions are pretty big. Salad was great. Peaches could be more carmelized as they were really just soggy but they still tasted great. My salad consisted of gorgonzola, cranberries, walnuts, arugala, spinach, and the avocado and crunchy-skinned salmon that i added. Great compliments to the salad and they had a nice portion of every ingrediant with a fresh lemon non-oily vinegrette which i appreciated. The food here is consistently good which is nice because alot of places are on and off in quality. Bread is ordinary and stale. Coffee and mango raspberry colada was great. Tiramisu for dessert was also lighter and really yummy ^.^ grandmother and aunt also had an apple crisp with icecream. My aunt always orders that i didn't try it but they liked it. I highly reccomend the place the staff was kind except the guy who seated us who seemed alittl too self loving and bro like. But everything was pretty good as it always is. I'm only in LA on my ocassionaly breaks so this place isn't on the top of my list. Wish we went someplace more LA-exotic as CPK is a chain all over and i'm not a big chain fan especially when it comes to resteraunts, but it's a good chain and i appreciate their accomodating menus.

While dining during a fundraiser for an elementary school, my party found the wait staff to be attentive and helpful.  I was surprised that 20% of the check would be donated to the school--including ALL beverages.  That is seldom the case in other establishments who support fundraisers for organizations.  Prior to our meal, our table ordered the Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadillas, which were thicker than expected, and the Tortilla Spring Rolls, which were cooked perfectly and very flavorful.  I selected the Moroccan-Spiced Chicken and have decided it is my new favorite salad.  The dish was full of roasted butternut squash, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, and a good amount of chicken that was not overly spiced.  The Champagne vinaigrette wasn't too sweet or overpowering considering the salad also contained cranberries and dates.  Our table also ordered the wild mushroom pizza that had just the right amount of wild mushroom walnut pesto in addition to the California Club Pizza that fortunately was not soggy.  Though all of our ordered items were tasty the highlight of the meal was the Salted Caramel Pudding.  The dessert was portioned perfectly and balanced the sweet caramel pudding, chocolate crumble crust, and sea salt so well that we ordered a second one!

Okay, before you guys think WHAT?!!! adfsud about my 1-star, let me explain. CPK has good food BUT... this branch is absolutely SHADY!! When I received my check, I noticed that the tax amount was way off scale from what it should have been. like WaY OFF. The tax in Northridge, CA is 8.25% but when I calculated the amount with my cellphone's calculator ( I have no shame in using it at a restaurant!!), the tax they used was 9.75% tax. WHAT THE HECK?!! that's illegal!!! So I talked to the manager and told him about my situation and all he said was "look, I have no time to go over this matter. The computer is right and I can't explain it right now. What do you want me to do; it's not worth it to lose you as a customer over a few dollar bills. I mean this has happened before, but I can't explain, the computer is right."  There are several problems with what he said: 1. the customer is always right until the manager proves otherwise 2. the computer doesn't automatically know what the tax % is of the location. it has to be manually inputted so obviously this is human error 3. don't belittle a customer and say it is only a few dollars 4. THIS HAS HAPPENED BEFORE???? obviously, the computer is wrong then! I was shocked and in disbelief. Imagine how much this branch is jipping people. If you do go here to eat, I advise you check your tax amount.

I had no problems when I went here. Yes, it's right by a mall so expected it to be a little crowded. It's not as bad as claim jumper and macaroni grill. I like that the lighting is good enough for you to see. We had a large party and they filled up all our glasses very quickly and took 30 overs from opposite ends of the table with no problems. The my plates and utensils did seem clean so I don't have any beef with this place. It's just another american sit-down restaurant.

Went here today. The food was alright, but nothing to write home about. The server really made us feel awkward and rushed. She was polite but seemed kind of fake, and right as we were finishing our meal demanded that we pay our bill asap because she had to pickup her daughter from school. That is all fine and dandy but it was quite uncomfortable and I have not experienced that at a restaurant before. We were not even really lingering for a long time. So we pay, sign the checks and put down the tip and before we can gather our bags and get up she is already grabbing her tips and the credit card slips in front of us as fast as she can go. It is isnt like it is the most offensive thing in the world, but it was unnecessary. I am sure she could have left and gotten her tips another time. Anyway, CPK should just make sure all employees are acting professionally and creating a comfortable atmosphere. Our lunch ended on kind of awkward note. :\

WELL PERSONALLY...AS CPK BEING A FRANCHISE. I have no idea what these people are talking about, but i LOVE CPK. One of my favorite places, and this place although crowded because it is located right outside the mall the wait is long but worth it. For lunch, or dinner a great place to go. Some of my favorites include: Appetizers- SEDONA TORTILLA SOUP, waldorf salad*, thai crunch salad, avacado rolls, SPINICH AND ARTICHOKE DIP, HUMMUS Meal- Fettuccine with garlic cream sauce (mushrooms and shrimp), Mango Tandoori Chicken Pizza?, BBQ Chicken Pizza, TOSTADA PIZZA, RAVIOLI WITH PORTABELLO MUSHROOMS (in red or cream sauce is GREAT), mostly all their pizza's are appetizing!!! Desserts- CHOCOLATE SOUFFLE OR APPLE CRISP!

Wow, this place was crowded.  It was after lunch, but before dinner and we had to wait to get in.  The service was great.  We had salads (BBQ chicken and Chinese chicken salad) and appetizers.  The hummus and pita bread were yummy.  The quesadilla were mediocre and we will most likely pass on those next time.  We were happy and left satisfied.

Stopped by for a fundraiser for my Kiwanis Club, and ended up ordering the Baby Clams and Linguini (which was delicious). The service was good and we all had a great time. I will definitely be back again!
Had lunch here twice recently, absolutely wonderful! Alanna served me both times and took great care of me, nothing was too much trouble for her. I'll certainly be back again!

I am not a big fan of this place and would prefer to go to other restaurant. The food is decent and prices are reasonable. It would be a good place to grab something to eat after doing some mall shopping. They have all type of pizzas that I have never heard off. Some are good and some I would avoid. Sometimes I think they just create something by throwing whatever they have in the back. Service is good and attentive and never really had an issue here. Only giving it three star because food doesn't amaze me and would not be my number 1 choice to go in the area.

We should have ordered pizza.  I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and my husband ordered spaghetti with a green salad to start. Everything was brought to us promptly, but together.  The server almost apologized, saying "the kitchen is making everything at once."  So hubby had to let his spaghetti get cold while he ate his salad.  My salad was covered with a cross between oyster sauce and teriyaki sauce which made it way too salty-sweet. It could have benefitted from some nice almonds and mandarin oranges to cut the sticky sweetness. A basic Chinese Chicken Salad dressing would have been an improvement from the brown teriyaki sauce.  The service was pretty darn good, but the food was mediocre.

As soon as we entered host Austin greeted us friendly and gave us a nice booth. Our server Tyler was very knowledgable about the menu and teas and he was very attentive and kind when my friend had many requests for him which became kind of comical, he took each one in stride and with a friendly and upbeat attitude. I had the California Cobb Salad with fresh beats, it comes in a very large portion and was filling. Then my friends and I were recommended the Butter Cake and it was such a hit with all of us! It was completely devoured! So good! :)

We were going to eat there before a movie. They sat us down and never came to greet us nor to take our order. Horrible experience. Will never visit this location again. Funny thing about them is, after I wrote the review on yelp, they asked me to contact them to try to make it right. I did, and they never even replied.

Awesome foods, best manager (Rebecca), Emily is Great (waiters), and also Yahi who works here! This resturant is our favorite with best service. I have bad experience only once! But it's happen! I highly recommend to all my friends and my family. It's very good, and cozy resturant which you can go with your kids! You need to go and try all their delicious food.

I dont tend to write reviews unless im extremly satisfied or completly unsatisfied. SO with that been said a group of friends and I attended this location just yesterday, and I must say we all really enjoyed ourselfs, the Food was amazing we all had pizaa and pasta the Spinach and artichoke pizza was my favorite. But what made it better was their Services! I used to be a server at a very busy restaurant so i always find myself playing extra close attention to other services, this time i was very satisfied our server was very friendly and kind she was fast and made sure we were all okay thru our dinner, (unfortunetly i dont remeber her name) we then moved to the bar where we were greated and served by ANNAMER, she was very friendly as well and made us feel comfortable, quick services and great attitude, Eventhough she seemed busy she always had time to make sure we were satisfied,and  she keeped our area clean. Over all experience, food, services, etc. we are ready to come more often to this CPK.
i love their pesto and salad here... best pizza... nice staff...  can get a little slow when its busy.. good location near the theater and the northridge mall =]
Food was good, service wasn't the best but I didn't expect it to be with how packed they were. I would probably try a different restaurant next time in the area.

Ordered Thai BBQ pizza & tried jambalaya.  Very tasty.  Hilary, our waitress and later, Gabrielle were cordial and friendly despite the busy night.  They served our large group of 12 last night and did an excellent job of taking the orders despite the noisy atmosphere and holiday crowd.
Always liked this place when I was younger, but lately they seem to be losing their touch!! Wait here is forever, but their bread baskets till today always win my heart over!

I always get the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, and it doesn't disappoint. The layout of the restaurant is nice and open. I've never had an issue with my order or service. Missing one star because they don't do happy hour.
This CPK rocks the server was AWESOME and the food was fantastic. We will definitely be back to this one!!!

Honestly, why does their bread have to be cold? It's a better restaurant than some of the choices at the Northridge mall, and it is popular. I'll be honest. I like the signature bbq chicken pizza. Margherita is good too. I enjoy the avocado spring rolls for an appetizer, as well as the red velvet cake. One of the best red velvet cakes out there, especially considering this is a popular chain restaurant and I've tried a lot of different red velvet cakes. You can usually share a pizza with another person or two.

I love CPK because they have such a big variety of Pizzas and Salads. Really they have something for everyone and for a chain restaurant they seem to always have fresh tasting food. I love the eggplant veggie pizza I get it without cheese and it's great. The tiramisu is soooo yummy.

Haven't been to one of these in a minute! I chose a kids event as my go back which wasn't such a horrible idea. So they have a thing called "Breakfast with the Easter Bunny" and like all the smart businesses they know what to say to get you IN all while they leave out those important little facts, those facts that once again I DIDN'T ask for like an idiot that I am. Ok so I get there and the hostess that morning was all smiles and TRIED to accomodate my party and I as best she could which is something that every customer likes. Bla bla bla we sit down and I'm looking for the bunny when I finally see IT I was so damn dissapointed. (no offense to the elderly)  FUCCEN BUNNY WAS WELL IN TO HIS/HER 50'S!! I mean hunching and with that slow walk you know the one the older people have (again no offense to the elderly) But give me a fuccen break CPK!!! OR THE MALL or whomever booked the bunny person! I seriously began to wonder exactly how the whole thing was gonna work. Anyway the bunny was walking around and they would take a picture THEN give you a stupid little card with instructions on how you can order the prints! FML!!! why would I ever think they would actually give you the damn picture?? NOTHING IS FREE!! and I know that but I wanted to thing positive. OK so our server was really nice she was more than nice she was great! ( : the "fruit bowl" was BS! but the pizzas were pretty good. They don't have jalapenos which sucks! but the have Chalula or whatever the hell that was which gave it a little kick enough to get me to eat one whole pizza by myself plus 4 fruit bowls! DON'T JUDGE ME! Point is it was only $8 per person and it included the drink plus the pizza and a fruit bowl. They had about 6 pizza choices which wasn't bad at all. I'm NOT a pizza fan and I'm def not a CPK fanatic but I wouldn't say it's horrible. I had a good experience here and therefore I wouldn't mind going back. ( :
service was bad. The artichoke dip is the best. Salad always fresh. BBQ Chicken with Applewood Smoked Bacon pizza is my favorite :)

Yes, it's a chain... but it's one of the best chains around. Bottom line, I could never get sick of their menu... nice, simple, delicious food. The Spinach Artichoke Dip is legendary. Every time I come here with a girl friend, we just look at each other, wondering if we both dare to brave the caloric intake and eat the glorious dip. But it's always worth it. BEST. DIP. EVER. Pizzas are nice and light... I love the BBQ Chicken Pizza. They also now let you order your pizza on a honey wheat / whole grain crust - which is actually pretty good. And for salads, I'm obsessed with the Original Chopped.  Actually addicted. Their regular bread kinda sucks, so ask for the pita bread instead. Yum.

This was one of the worst cpk's in terms of pizza quality, but they have changed a couple things: Their crust is waaaaay better now, much more flakier/puffier/crisper. Their bread which tasted like it just came out of the refrigerator now had a nice warm, sourdough toasted dough (about fucking time how nastee was those pre-sliced cold mini-loafs) with a side of butta and nicely seasoned olive oil with spices. Like it. I would give them 4 stars but service was awful, even had to flag down another employee to get the check, never had refill check, etc. It was a thursday night; hate flagging down employess instead of responsible server doing their job.  As far as food went (our orders): split pea and barley soup---4.5 stars, with some lemon squeezed very good appetizzy. Green onions totaly unnecessary. They need more soup variety; its either this or that tortilla chicken which can be real good or bad depending on location. Bell pepper, pepperoni, and mushroom pizza=was quite good, with revamped crust big difference. And actually had some god-damn tomato sauce on it finally. Kung-pao spaghetti=fucking insanely gross item with thick noodles. Its not really their fault, and wifey ordered it, told her not to. Its prob grossest item you can order. I guess no moping up duty for husband this evening. Their pizzas are really good now, all due to crust upgrade. But service was a disappointment big time, hence the average rating.

Our meal was delicious and the customer service was great! I recommend their margaritas! We had a little trouble finding the restaraunt but other than that it was a perfect dining experience. We will definitely be back!

My girlfriend & I came here right after having a horrible experience @ claimjumper. We told our server(Ralphy) about what we just went thru & he aplogized for another rstrnts crappy service. He was very professional, polite & respectful. He checked up on us often and made sure we had everything we need it to make our stay pleasant. Thanks again, Ralphy. We'll be seeing U soon

This was an alright place. I came here late at night, 9 pm upon reservations for a rainy night. Bar staff were friendly but waitress was mediocre. Waitress just seemed to want to get our order with no room for small talk or up sale. Food did take awhile to get out. Pizza was also mediocre,  especially the small thin size it was presented. Felt like I could make the pizza, I ate, at home for a small fraction of what I paid an arm and a leg for. Drinks, mango mojito, weren't strong enough either, didn't seem they had much life in them either. Overall, place was alright. Very casual setting with cheesy music playing in the background in between jazzy songs. Place has a lot of potential to be better.

I had a really good experience here last night with my family for an early valentine dinner.  The waitress Karrah gave us a really pleasant experience!   She was so nice and entertaining.  Me and my husband enjoyed our food while my son was enjoying himself at the bar after he ate his dinner with us.  Karrah was so sweet to watch over him and keep him busy.  The food was great and was even better with the extraordinary service we got!  Thanks Karrah!  Hope to see you again soon!
Had BBQ chicken, vegetable and cheese pizza plus tortilla salad delivered w an asst of cookies. Best was the cookies and BBQ chicken pizza. Overall eehhh

I mean really, what's not to like about CPK?!  Love their Thai Chicken pizza and their mango iced tea.  I used to get their Chicken Caesar salad sandwich but they recently changed the bread from foccacia to a ciabatta.  Not a fan of that change at all.  Their pesto pasta is also pretty good with the addition of chicken or shrimp or both.  All the other pizzas are pretty good too but my fave is the Thai Chicken.  The crust is thin but not too thin and though I'm more of a fan for thick crust, CPK's pizza crust works.  Service is on point and parking lot is huge.  Not too shabby.
The 5 stars are for Phil. Phil was our server today and we really enjoyed his service and company. Def will request for him to be our server again!!!

Great food ! Drinks and food came very quickly, which is nice considering we came on a friday night. The drinks weren't mixed very well and super strong. Bad thing? Ill let you decide. Overall great food and will be returning!

I've been going to CPK since 1990.  This is the worst CPK in the valley!  Poorly managed and completely under staffed.  We waited 40 minutes with open tables and another 20 minutes for drinks and just to order.  Don't waste your time or money! Also, CPK's recent menu changes have removed my 3 favorite dishes and the prices are through the roof. CPK has fallen from our families list of restaurants.
Simply good food! The pizza is great and love the Farmers Market Soup. Friendly folks and nice ambiance.

We love CPK and with few exceptions we always have a great experience when we dine here. This isn't a 5 star dining establishment by any means but the food is very tasty and we come back often. We almost always get the Thai crunch salad and this time we had the flatbread with mushroom and spinach also. It was tasty but not worth the price in my opinion. Our Thai crunch salad was exceptional as always but was just a tad bit on the small side to fill us up. I think CPK should offer 3 different sizes of their salads for people with different appetite sizes. A size small, medium, and large size salads would be perfect as we tend to share our salad when we get one.  And of course the butter cake is to die for!!! Make sure you get it with a scoop or two of Haagen Daz ice cream however!!! YUMMY!! Mmmm Mmm

Every few times I have been here, I have had poor service.  The waiter spends time talking to other waiters instead of servicing his tables effectively.  Food is only okay.  Bread is not warm, glasses are left empty for a while... Until he needs to come because you have asked others to get him for you.  Word of advice, don't go there unless you have time to kill as you most likely will not get a decent waiter.

So my bf and I decided to do lunch here. Thought it'd be nice to do the outdoor seating. The hostess was friendly and sat us down quickly despite the Saturday rush.  Our waiter Brandon took our drink orders. I was indecisive and it looked as if it annoyed him. He said he'd come back later to get the orders, which I thought made sense. We did order our appetizer, which didn't take too long. Our meals however did take longer than expected. Considering that I had ordered the chicken ceaser salad I didn't expect for there to be a delay on that. We had to remind the server a few times about our order of bread and second round of drinks. At one point that same hostess from earlier  walked by our table and coughed without covering her mouth.  This is pretty gross considering my glass of iced water was on the table uncovered. We had asked our server what the hold up was on the food, he seemed confused about why we'd ask. I understand it may have been busy and he may have been overwhelmed,  but his service seemed lackluster. It seemed as if he was more attentive to the tables around us. I know what youre probably thinking, that we were loud, obnoxious, and picky patrons. If that was the case I would have found his service understandable.   However, my bf and I were completely understanding of the wait and shitty service. So after asking him about the food, it surprisingly  came out minutes later.  It was delicious. At least until hours later both my bf and I experienced abdominal pain and diarrhea. Don't know if this was a coincidence or not but truth be told, Im not happy about my recent experience with CPK.  They even took my favorite dish off the menu. This place was once a favorite, now its just overpriced mediocre food at best.  Don't know if it was an 'off' day for the server but he should've not stayed out too late the night before or not shown up to work at all! Ugh!
Place was okay in customer service. The food was good as always I wish the staff was a bit friendly

Just go to yard house next door! Better food and service. Have had horrible experiences at this location. Bad customer service. I ordered curbside and showed up to find out they had no idea! Turns out they booked it for another day!?! Will not return. Food is mediocre at best

I'm in love with there butter cake! It's the best dessert I ever had!..It's a cake that melts in your mouth when you eat it kind of like chocolate fudge but with butter cake, It's Sweet and filling, it can be a little sweet but I usually share. I like there pizza too but I usually just get it with pineapples only, but still really good. They have Hummus and I like it, it is well prepared with there pizza bread.

Had a great experience their. The food was good and the service phenomenal. Went their for lunch and ordered a Club Sandwich with Tortilla soup. Felt good going down in this weird cold weather we are having. I will go back again. Thank you CPK.

I don't think CPK's food is "outstanding", I think it fits in the same category as Olive Garden and other mediocre Italian places. I've ordered the spaghetti, linguine and clam sauce, and their carne asada pizza. Overall, it's just "ok". If you want GOOD Italian, walk about 20 feet away to Macaroni Grill.
